name: Abracadaniel
description: Abracadaniel first appears in the episode "Wizard Battle." He enters Wizard Battle in the hopes of winning money, but when he learns that the prize is a kiss from Princess Bubblegum, he resigns himself to be killed by another wizard. Finn and Jake (as Magic Fist) promise to help him win when they learn he has no interest in kissing the princess. To win Wizard Battle, Abracadaniel transforms Ice King's nunchaku into a living butterfly. When the transformed butterfly flies above Ice King, Abracadaniel transforms it back into nunchaku, after which it falls on Ice King and knocks him out. Because Abracadaniel beats Ice King and won the Wizard Battle, he determines that he had become a man and wants the kiss from Princess Bubblegum. A shocked Finn screams viciously in his face, knocking him out and causing him to lose the Wizard Battle. His gender-swapped version is Abracadanielle.

name: Abracadanielle
description: Abracadanielle is the gender-swapped version of Abracadaniel. She appears briefly in "Fionna and Cake and Fionna."

name: Abraham "Abe" Lincoln
description: Abraham "Abe" Lincoln was the King of Mars who debuts in the original animated short, where he encourages Finn to believe in himself after warping his brain in the past and to Mars. His first appearance in the official series is in one of the framed pictures in Hunson Abadeer's house. Lincoln plays a major role in the episode "Sons of Mars," where he loses his immortality (and seemingly his life) in order to save Jake after he was accidentally killed and sent to the 37th Dead World. As a result, Lincoln turns to stone and becomes a statue for all of eternity.

name: Acoustics Princess
description: Acoustics Princess was briefly mentioned in Adventure Time Issue 5. She told Finn that if he were to sing loud enough at the correct frequency, he could shatter any pot. This helped him free Lamprey Princess from a pot without stepping out of line. It is unknown when she told him how to do this or why. It is also unknown what she looks like or where she lives.

name: Adventure Tim
description: Adventure Tim is a character in the Adventure Time comic. He is, in fact, two people who share one body and take turns talking. He rescues princesses from Mice King, has a robot named ALN, is friends with Princess Chewypaste and Cinnamon Roll, and dates Lady Unibow. Where he lives, instead of dealing with the Earl of Lemongrab, Tree Trunks, Me-Mow, and The Lich, they interact with the Duke of Limesnatch, Topiary Nose, Mow-Me, and the Loch (who is apparently some sort of lake). Tim goes on adventures similar to those that Finn and Jake go on. He is somehow related or connected to Finn and Jake, as their actions have an influence over him.

name: Agent Princess
description: Agent Princess (also known as "Arsonist Princess") is a princess and a vigilante freelance who first appears in Adventure Time: Candy Capers Issue 4.

name: Air (previously Bubble)
description: At the end of "I Am a Sword," BMO says "I like Air" when Jake suggests they go outside for some fresh air.

name: Albert
description: Albert is a giant bear Finn encounters in the Islands miniseries episode "Mysterious Island." Albert finds Finn trapped inside a net and continues to try and eat him until Alva, his owner, frees him. Albert lives under Alva's care inside of a tree where he suspends himself from a hammock. He makes a cameo appearance in the episode "The Light Cloud," when the scene shifts to the Weather Island inhabitants as Minerva attempts to upload everyone from the islands for their protection.

name: Unknown
description: Later in the episode, Princess Bubblegum sets off a rocket that resembles her countenance into the sky. Seconds, after it flies into space, Tree Trunks is abducted by aliens, who point out the rocket that has crashed into their realm. The rocket head opens to let out streams of candy matter, which begin to invade and attach themselves to the aliens' bodies. Tree Trunks is transported back to Ooo, and she immediately berates Princess Bubblegum for hurting the aliens. Princess Bubblegum is surprised that Tree Trunks knows the rocket went into space but insists she does not know what she's talking about. Later, Tree Trunks and PB are both transported to the alien world.

name: ALLMO
description: ALLMO is the forced combination of almost every MO. One day, AMO sent the MOs down the Mo Factory's trash compactor with the intent to kill them. As the accumulation of every kind of MO, its intelligence is like that of a supercomputer; however, it only knows what it sees and lacks the imagination of BMO to help it think outside the box. It and ALLMO are on very good terms after the horrible ordeal with AMO. It hoped for BMO to live with it in the factory as its leader but BMO politely declined.

name: ALN
description: ALN is a video game computer that is similar to BMO and lives with Adventure Tim. He makes his only appearance in Issue 5.

name: Alva
description: Alva is the first human Finn encounters on the islands. She is introduced in the episode "Mysterious Island."

name: AMO
description: AMO was one of the several MOs created by Moe. Similarly to how BMO was made to give love, he was designed to receive it, which ironically made AMO reject that purpose.

name: Amoeba
description: The Amoeba is a germ-like creature that appears in "Evicted!" In the episode, it appears at Finn and Jake's party in the cave. It has a purple body, cilia, ribosomes, mitochondria, a nucleus, a centriole, and other parts that appear to be normal organelles.

name: Ancient Psychic Tandem War Elephant
description: The Ancient Psychic Tandem War Elephant appears in "The Limit" when Finn wished for him at the center of the magic Labyrinth. Jake reminded Finn that "you have to let it give you control," which Finn did by communicating with it telepathically. At Finn's request, the elephant then wished for Finn's friends to be healed and helped the group escape the maze.

name: Life Giving Magus
description: The Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving (also referred to as the Life Giving Magus) is a wizard who has the ability to phase through objects, fly, and give life to inanimate objects. The alignment of the newly animated creature depends on his mood when he touches it. He first appears in the center of the dungeon in "Mystery Dungeon," engulfed in blue flames, and later returns as a main character in "Little Dude."

name: Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving's father
description: Not much is known about the Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving's father. The Magi noted his father did not love him, called him a bad wizard, and offended him. He doesn't seem to be pleased thinking about his father, thus making everything he brings to life evil while thinking about him. He is only mentioned in "Little Dude."

name: Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving's mother
description: Not much is known about the Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving's mother. The Magi noted that his mother loved him and kissed him every time he came back from wizard school. He also seems to be happy thinking about his mother, so when he thinks about her everything he brings to life is good. She was only mentioned in "Little Dude."

name: Animals
description: A large amount of animals appeared in the episode "Memories of Boom Boom Mountain." They were first used by the Marauders as cushions to keep their rough-housing less violent, requested by the giant crying Mountain Man. The Mountain Man didn't like the idea of using animals to soften the Marauders blows so Finn pets one of the marauders to get them to stop fighting. The Marauders and the animals become as obsessed as they were about rough-housing to petting each raw.

name: Ann
description: Ann is a Candy Person who runs the Candy Drugstore. She was introduced in "Candy Streets." She has a tendency to ramble when she talks. She also pays lots of attention to the details that people say with a very powerful memory capable of remembering even the smallest bit of details that are mentioned.

name: Ant
description: The ant is a harmless bug that appears in "The Enchiridion!" After Finn slays the Heart Beast, the Dark Magician commands him to kill the ant. However, Finn refuses to kill it because it was not evil. Finn escapes from the Dark Magician's "brain world" by kicking him in the crotch.

name: Ant
description: The Ants appear in the episode "Storytelling." Finn finds them under a rock while he is looking for the "romance" part of the story for Jake. After Finn asks them whether they are in love, one of the ants begins to get angry and yells at him in a strange language, so Finn puts the rock back on top of them. The ant who spoke had a masculine voice and straighter antennae than the other, who was crying silently.

name: Antelope
description: The Antelope is a minor character who appears in the episode "Hug Wolf." The Alpha Hug Wolf hugs him, which makes him feel uncomfortable because apparently, he is spoken for.

name: Aquandrius
description: Aquandrius is a magical creature that appears in "The Limit." He appears to be a muddy serpent that rewards travelers able to find the center of the Labyrinth by awarding them wish orbs.

name: Arklothac
description: Arklothacs a multi-dimensional candy god-like that appears in the comics. He is a giant red monster that an Italian chef mask on his head. He was summoned from beyond time and space by the witch Ganice Bizzlethatcher. He was defeated by finn with the moon sword. He then returns with his fellow then and rain chaos on the world and presumably kill the main cast excluding Finn. Later Penelope with the moon sword and Finn help kills and then erased him from existence with the other.

name: Armadillo
description: The Armadillo is a character who appears in "Angel Face." He is seen near the end of the episode to collect the bounty on Jack Rabbit Johnson. BMO then scares him off by telling him he has already collected the bounty.

name: Ash
description: Ash reappears briefly in the episode "Betty" when Simon Petrikov steals his flying carpet to escape Wizard City. Ironically, both Simon and Ash were close to Marceline at different times, but neither knew the other. Ash mentions being a busker in Wizard City, and is shown to still have his Cherry Blossom Wand. Later in the episode, Marceline willingly sacrifices Hambo so Simon can reunite with his lost love Betty Grof.

name: Baby Spider
description: The Baby Spiders were introduced in the episode "Web Weirdos." They are very small compared to their parents, who are giant-sized spiders. They were birthed from their mother's egg sac as live young, having developed inside of her abdomen. Upon their birth, they spouted out by the thousands, covering their surroundings, including Finn and Jake, in a heaping pile. Their arrival brought on the reconciliation of their parents.

name: Bad Guy Magpie
description: Bad Guy Magpie was the owner of the Casino Castle. After Agent Princess lost all her money gambling she believed the legitimate casino was rigged to cheat and began messing with Bad Guy Magpie, who kidnapped Peppermint Butler when he visited the Casino Castle, believing him to be Agent Princess in disguise. She attempted to kill him but Agent Princess saved him at the last second and blew up the Casino Castle. Bad Guy Magpie proclaimed the Casino Castle would be her last honest venture.

name: Bad Haircut Wizard
description: Bad Haircut Wizard is a wizard who lives on the outskirts of Bloodskull Village. As his name would suggest his power comes from his terrible haircut and he can curse others to have bad haircuts. When Bloodskull Village was cursed, drafted heroes Marceline and Tree Trunks confronted him, only to learn the only person he cursed was Charlie Mayor with an eternal bad haircut. He was also infatuated with Tree Trunks due to supposed beautiful hair.

name: Bagel
description: The Bagel makes its only appearance in the episode "The Witch's Garden." The Witch confuses it with a donut because it is growing on her donut bushes in her garden. She accuses the bagel of being a liar and casts a spell on it, causing it to grow legs and wear underwear. The bagel then starts wiggling its legs, apparently brought to life.

name: Balloons
description: The Balloons make their first appearance in "Ricardio the Heart Guy." They fly up on screen in this episode when Princess Bubblegum says that she'll throw a party for Finn and Jake for rescuing her from Ice King once again. The screen says "PARTY TIME!" and the balloons fly up, transitioning to the next scene.

name: Balthus
description: Balthus is a Fire Elemental that first appears in the episode "Evergreen." He, along with Chatsberry and Slimy D, were the main opponents to Evergreen's proposal to prevent the destruction of life on the planet. He was later reincarnated as Flame Princess, and again as X.

name: Banana Guards
description: The Banana Guards wear armor that has them look like cut bananas with chocolate poured on top, along with some pieces of what appears to be sugar. They are taller than most characters as displayed when they tower over Princess Bubblegum. Their feet are popsicle sticks and they hold long bronze sticks topped with diamond-shaped gems that have similar color to the sugar like cubes on their head. While they look like popsicles, they are actually bananas that have popsicle stick legs. Early banana guards resembled plantains. Although most guards are shown to be male, a female Banana Guard is seen in "We Fixed a Truck" and multiple females are seen in "The Thin Yellow Line." In the Episode "Rattleballs" an Injured Banana Guard is missing the top portion of his armor which shows his head, this particular Guard appears to have black hair.

name: Banana Man
description: Banana Man is a character in Adventure Time. His first appearance is in the episode "The New Frontier."

name: Bandit Princess
description: Bandit Princess is a thief princess who makes her first appearance in "I Am a Sword." In her debut episode, she steals the Finn Sword and uses it to steal gold and kill people. She eventually makes her way into the Spiky Kingdom where she steals gold and cuts off the mayor's head.

name: Bandito
description: Bandito is a character who appears in the episode "The Eyes." He is a bandit that is captured and then tied up by Finn and Jake. He was referred to by Jake as "bandito," similar to the Spanish and Portuguese word for "bandit," bandido. Apparently, the Sheriff wanted help in capturing him for some reason, most likely for committing theft, as is the deal with most bandits.

name: Barb
description: Barb is a spider who is introduced in "Web Weirdos." She is married to Ed. She is upset with Ed because he thinks it is gross when she spins webs, and he insists that she spin one. Following Finn's advice, Ed tries to give her a glowing sword as a gift, but she thinks he got it for himself. They get into a fight in which Barb tries to eat Ed, but Finn saves him. Barb then goes into contractions, and she gives birth to thousands of Baby Spiders. She and Ed then make up.

name: Bartholomew
description: Bartholomew exists approximately 1000+ years into the future Ooo and is supposedly "built" by Marceline (or as she is later known: "The Empress") from BMO's recycled parts. He and his brothers (Mingus and Orange Juice) have been tasked with retrieving found artifacts to the Empress as part of their allegiance to her.

name: Bartram
description: Bartram "Bar Bar" is the pet mule of Farmworld Finn. He appears in the Season 5 premiere episodes "Finn the Human" and "Jake the Dog." During most of the episodes, Finn calls him "Bar Bar." Bartram can apparently climb trees, as Finn finds him high up on a branch.

name: Basketball Wizard
description: Basketball Wizard is a character who appears in Issue 12 of the Adventure Time comic book series. He registers to take part in the wizard battle being organized by Finn, Jake and Marceline during their search for Ewlbo. Marceline beats him up for stealing all of her basketballs.

name: Baskets & Boots Owner
description: The Baskets & Boots Owner is first introduced in "City of Thieves." He is a blue man that wields a fly swatter, apparently to keep thieves from stealing his baskets and boots. He is first seen sleeping at his post when he is woken up by Finn telling Jake not to steal from him. When he sees that Jake is trying to steal from him, he swats him away with his fly swatter and yells, "Hey! Go away!" It seems that he must have fallen asleep again, because later in the episode Jake is seen wearing boots he stole, which he later uses to defend Finn from Penny.

name: Bat
description: The Bat appears in "Evicted!" dancing at Finn and Jake's cave party.

name: Bath Boy Gang
description: The Bath Boy Gang is a group of male humanoids that threatens Princess Bubblegum in the early days of the Candy Kingdom in the episode "The Vault." They want Princess Bubblegum's amulet, but Shoko fails to retrieve it for them. They frequently attack the Candy Kingdom, leading Princess Bubblegum to create the Gumball Guardians for protection. Only four members appear onscreen.

name: Bath Boy Gang leader
description: The Bath Boy Gang leader is the leader of the Bath Boy Gang in the episode "The Vault." He threatens Princess Bubblegum in the early days of the Candy Kingdom. He sends Shoko on a mission to steal Princess Bubblegum's amulet with the promise of making her a member of the Bath Boy Gang if she succeeds and death should she fail. It is unknown what happens to him or his gang.

name: Battle Cubes
description: Battle Cubes are a group of creatures that appear in the episode "Business Time" when they try to harm and capture Hot Dog Princess. They resist all attempts by Finn and Jake to defeat them. After a long time, Finn and Jake get very tired and ask the Business Men to fight for a while so they can take a break to rest. During their break, the Business Men give Finn and Jake orange slices and bottled water. Since Finn had time to rehydrate, he got an idea and made a plan to defeat the Battle Cubes. Jake made his paw grow big and caught all of the Battle Cubes. Finn then tied them all up with rope and made a giant cube. They then tossed the cube away. It is possible that battle cubes are associated with the Cube People or the Cube Village. They may be a sub-species of Cube People.

name: Bazooka Goblin
description: The Bazooka Goblin was a goblin that wielded a bazooka in Finn and Jake's Tree Fort, as "seen" in the episode "Rainy Day Daydream." When everything that Jake imagined became real, the Bazooka Goblin was created. It was going to blast Finn and Jake, but Finn repeatedly said not to do it. The goblin laughs hysterically for a moment, but he obeys Finn. The Bazooka Goblin's appearance is unknown, as everything Jake imagines is invisible. Only Jake can see it.

name: Bear
description: The Bear is a major character in the episode "In Your Footsteps." After Finn saves it from choking, the Bear follows him and Jake to the Tree Fort. It tries to copy Finn because it wants to be a hero. Finn gives him the Enchiridion instead, which the bear later gives to the Lich-possessed Snail.

name: Beau
description: Beau is a character that appears in the episode "Thanks for the Crabapples, Giuseppe." He rides the bus with Ice King, Abracadaniel, Ron James, Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving, Little Dude, Leaf Man, Giuseppe, and the Nymphs to Big Butt Rock. He does not do or say much on the trip, though he appears to get along with Ice King, as they are seen playing rock-paper-scissors in the background, and is shown enjoying Leaf Man's poem. He is presumably part of the secret society the wizards formed at the end of the episode.

name: Beautiful Lady
description: The Beautiful Lady is a character that was introduced in the episode "Hug Wolf." Finn is turned into a Hug Wolf because he is hugged by the Alpha Hug Wolf during a full moon. Finn and Jake were trying to kill the Tree of Blight when this happened. The Alpha Hug Wolf turns out to be a female humanoid. At the very end of the episode, her head morphs into something resembling the Tree of Blight.

name: Beaver
description: The Beaver appears in "Susan Strong." He frightens Susan and steals three marshmallows from Finn. In the storyboards for the episode "Susan Strong," the Beaver wrestled with Finn. A different-looking beaver is seen in the earlier episode "Storytelling."

name: Bebe
description: Bebe is a TV remote control who appears in "BMO Noire." He is the owner of Bebe's, a dance club downtown. BMO accuses him of stealing Finn's sock after Lorraine points the finger at him. He and Lorraine were having an affair behind Ronnie's back and Ronnie kills him, by removing his batteries, out of jealousy.

name: Bee
description: The Bee appears in the episode "Evicted!" when Jake, along with Finn, tries to move into its hive by forcing his foot into the entrance (during the House Hunting Song). The bee vomits honey on both of them to scare them away. Later, at Finn and Jake's cave party, the bee flies into Mr. Cupcake's frosting and gets stuck in it.

name: Bee Princess
description: Bee Princess made brief cameo appearances in the episode "What is Life?" and in Ice King's Imagination Zone, and also appears in "Loyalty to the King." She was not seen attending Princess Day, implying she is one of the unregistered princesses in Ooo.

name: Bella Noche
description: Bella Noche is a being of pure anti-magic and the main antagonist of the episode "Betty." It exists in another dimension and has the power to remove other people's magic. Bella Noche can escape its dimension by using a unique staff (in this case the staff of Stranson Doughblow), a sword, an orb, and a goblet arranged inside of a circle drawn on the ground.

name: Bellamy Bug
description: Bellamy Bug appears in Finn's imagination in the episode "Rainy Day Daydream." He speaks with a British accent and claims to represent Finn's secret desire to be civilized. He offers Finn a doily soaked in the tears of his daughter, who had just broken up with a gentle dandy. He is then smacked by Finn, who uses his imagination to turn the bug's arms into a robot arm and an octopus tentacle, which both proceed to pummel him. He is then carried away by a group of penguins.

name: Berdzerd
description: Berdzerd makes a very minor appearance in the episode "Thanks for the Crabapples, Giuseppe." He does a "secret wizard handshake" with another minor character in the episode, named Chinchizard. The two appear to be part of a secret wizard society, though they tend to openly brag about their secret handshake and secret meetings to make other wizards such as Abracadaniel feel excluded. Berdzerd is also able to fly by flapping his wing-arms.

name: Betony Burrito Jakson IV
description: Betony "Beth" Burrito Jakson IV[1] (full title: Beth, the Pup Princess) is a character who exists in the future. She is a close friend of Shermy, who made her first and only appearance in the series finale "Come Along With Me."

name: Betty Grof
description: Betty Grof was a human-turned-wizard woman revealed to have once been the fiancée of a man named Simon Petrikov, who would much later become the Ice King. She and Petrikov were in a committed relationship until Simon obtained an enchanted crown, which gradually began to alter his body and warp his mind.

name: Big Destiny
description: Big Destiny (also called Big "D") is the leader of the Destiny Gang. His only appearances are in the episodes "Finn the Human," "Jake the Dog," and "Crossover." In the episode "Finn The Human," he took Finn's crown and wore it as "crown shorts," the crown which was formerly owned by "Simon Petrikov" who froze the bomb in mid-flight that would've put the Lich into existence. He is adept at fighting with a sword. He and his gang often use incorrect grammar and resort to a crude form of English which often confuses the plurality and singularity of the nouns and verbs (e.g. "property of old dead person go to Big Destiny"). He was last seen partly frozen in ice.

name: Big Guy
description: Big Guy is a character who appears in the episode "City of Thieves." He is the first character in the episode to have something stolen from him. His ring gets taken from him by Short Goblin. He angrily breaks through his wall and steals Skeleton Baby from Skeleton Mom. While he is running, Skeleton Baby steals a ruby from his teeth, which then gets stolen by Mr. Turtle.

name: Bikini babes
description: The Bikini babes first appeared in "Shh!". They were invited by BMO to come to the Tree Fort and dance to the song "No Wonder I." They later appear in the episode "Breezy" outside the Tree Fort.

name: Billy
description: In his youth, Billy had a reputation as a powerful warrior in the Land of Ooo. He was known for impressive feats, such as rescuing Cotton Candy Princess from the Fire Count, slaying an Evil Ocean, and fighting a giant bear. Around this time, Billy dated Canyon, and the power couple often went on motorcycle rides while fighting monsters. Billy's greatest accomplishment as a warrior was when he defeated the Lich before it could destroy Ooo with the unholy power gathered from the Earth's life force. The hero was then able to trap the Lich in an amber prison by pummeling it into the resin on the pinnacle of the Candy Castle.

name: Bird inside out
description: The bird inside out first appears in the episode "Freak City." Magic Man whistles, prompting the bird to land on his hand. He then rubs his thumb and forefinger together and flicks his hand upward, and the bird's feathers and skin turn inside out, causing its intestines to appear on the outside. Since it has no feathers, it has trouble flying. The bird greatly disturbed Jake; he had to think of happy thoughts to forget about it. It is unlikely that the bird is still alive, due to the condition it was left in.

name: Bird Nest Worm
description: The Bird Nest Worm is a pink earthworm that appears in the Season 5 episode "BMO Lost." After BMO is carried off by a giant pink bird, BMO quietly crawls out of the nest and onto the edge of the steep cliff that the bird's nest is perched on. Just as it begins to take its first step, however, the Bird Nest Worm springs out of the side of the nest yelling that it isn't safe out there and that BMO is more than welcome to hide in there. This startles BMO, causing it to tumble down the ledge, where BMO then meets Bubble. Seeing his mistake, the Bird Nest Worm sighs and says, "Oh, shoot, man. Uh-oh." The worm was clearly only trying to help, but due to his spastic nature, he misses an opportunity to find company.

name: Bird Woman
description: Bird Woman is a character who is represented as Gunter in a dream in the episode "Hoots." She gets intrigued by the Cosmic Owl who is attracted to her and tried to follow her wherever she went. She was first seen in Finn's dream and the Cosmic Owl found her back in an unknown dream with a huge party. She then follows the Cosmic Owl home and asks if she can go into Princess Bubblegum's dream.

name: Birds
description: Birds are animals commonly found throughout the Land of Ooo. Aside from a few exceptions, most species of birds are shown to be winged, two-legged organisms with some form of a beak.

name: Blacksmith
description: Blacksmith is a Dewdrop who lives in the roots of the Tree Fort. In "Little Brother," the blacksmith gives Kent directions on how to build a new sword, beginning his quest through the tree. Once he has gathered the materials–some unbreakable ore, a clod of mystic earth, and the sacred flame–the blacksmith builds Kent his new sword, which he dubs "Punch Party." Thanks to the blacksmith's help, Kent vanquishes the Rat King, allowing the flowers of the Tree Fort to bloom once more.

name: Blake
description: Blake is a magical dog and is best friends with Flynn. He looks very similar to Jake. He appears to be a golden retriever.

name: Blanket Dragon
description: The Blanket Dragon is a creature that appears in the episode "Puhoy." The Blanket Dragon makes a short appearance after several Pillow People run past Finn, alarmed by the approaching Blanket Dragon. After running into his leg, a small pillow child warns Finn, "Hey, mista', you better get wunning! Blanket dwagon!" in a stereotypical child-like voice.

name: Blargetha
description: Blargetha is the younger sister of Slime Princess. She first appears in "Love Games," in which she plans to take over the Slime Kingdom and turn it into a military force, to take over all of Ooo. In order to get control of the kingdom from her sister, she has to get married, but by Slime People standards she is so attractive that no man can work up the nerve to approach her; therefore, she makes a fake husband named Guillermo and is about to take over the kingdom, until Slime Princess convinces Finn to pretend to be her husband. They eventually find out the truth about Guillermo, thus disqualifying her from the challenge for the kingdom's rule.

name: Blastronaut
description: Blastronaut is a hitman hitman (a hitman who performs "hits" on other hitmen) who first appears in "Hitman." Ice King hires him to take out Scorcher, whom Ice King accidentally hired to kill Finn and Jake.

name: Bliblob
description: His body is composed of four white spheres: the biggest in the middle, with eyes and the mouth and two arms; a medium size above the head with three horizontal stripes (pink, yellow and green); and two small-sized segments below the head (one of them has a bruise due the aftermath of the battle to the Tree Fort), connecting it with two legs. His face has little detail, two eyes and a mouth, and is relatively simple like most Adventure Time characters.

name: Blindfold Guy
description: Blindfold Guy makes his only appearance in "Five Short Graybles." He operates the lever on the catapult that Finn uses to do the "super ultimate high-five." After pulling the lever, he fell off the catapult and lay motionless on the ground.

name: Blueberry Cops
description: The Blueberry cops are policemen that first appear in the episode "Candy Streets" where they stop Finn and Jake from climbing aboard the train Pete Sassafras is in for not having any tickets. They are preparing to arrest them, but Finn and Jake convince them to check if they are good. In response, one of the cops licks Jake. Realizing that they are trying to solve a case, Finn and Jake are released.

name: BMO
description: BMO (abbreviated from "Be More," phonetically spelled "Beemo", also referred to as Moe Mastro Giovanni Jr. and called the "New King of Ooo" in the future) is Finn and Jake's living video game console system, portable electrical outlet, computer, music player, VCR, video player, video editor, roommate, camera, alarm clock, toaster, flashlight, strobe light, skateboarder, soccer player, tape player, chef, detective, and friend. They make their appearance in the title scene of the Theme Song of every episode of Adventure Time, just as Finn and Jake pound their fists together. BMO is characterized as a loyal, trusting and helpful robot who is protective of Finn and Jake.

name: Bob Rainicorn
description: Bob Rainicorn is the father of Lady Rainicorn and the husband of Ethel Rainicorn who appears in "Her Parents."

name: Bobby
description: Bobby is a hero and the Farmworld equivalent of Billy. He first appears in the episode "Crossover," where almost his whole body shown to be encased in ice in Farmworld Finn's attempt to "save" humanity.

name: Boilbee
description: Boilbee is the rude ghost from the grave next to Ghost Princess' grave in "Ghost Princess." Boilbee explains that Ghost Princess has been buried in the Cemetery longer than most of the other ghosts, and also that she goes around at night scaring people because she can't deal with her issues. Clarence throws a cheese-puff at him, and makes him go back into his grave by speaking affectionately of Ghost Princess.

name: Boney
description: Boney first appears in "Vault of Bones" when Finn and Flame Princess are exploring a dungeon while he was fishing. Flame Princess wanted to burn him alive, but Finn said that that would be "a little cruel, even for an evil guy." Finn then demonstrated to Flame Princess how to "shake them down" to get loot from him. Finn made the skeleton do the splits and give him a map. The skeleton does not like it when Finn yells.

name: Bongo
description: Bongo is the ghostly drummer of Marceline's band. He claims to be the ghost of a famous drummer, but it remains unknown as to whether he really is.

name: Boobafina
description: Boobafina makes an appearance in the episodes "Storytelling" and "Come Along With Me." She has a crush on Mr. Goose, and to complicate matters, Mr. Fox is infatuated with Boobafina, and they kiss against their will, courtesy of Finn. She becomes upset because she feels Mr. Goose will now never have feelings for her because she's been "soiled." However, at the Rite of Forest Justice, it is revealed that Mr. Goose had been wanting to date her for years. The two were both happy to know of each other's affections while Mr. Fox, on the other hand, was told to move on, and he admits it is for the best. Her relationship with Mr. Fox is now unclear.

name: Booboo
description: Booboo is a ghost that appears in "Heat Signature." He is a ghost with two heads. He helps Marceline prank Finn and Jake but, just like his fellow ghosts, takes it too far. Likewise, he is portrayed as being cruel and mean. He seems to have had a spot in Marceline's former gang from the underworld.

name: Booger
description: A Booger makes an appearance in "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II," where Shelby points it out as one of the those who got together to watch videos on the floor. In Holly Jolly Secrets Part I, Finn mentioned that the Ice King buried his tapes in a pile of boogers. Another booger appears again in "Marceline's Closet" after Marceline picks her nose. The fact that boogers are recognizable in any way as characters is attributed to that apparently they can have jackets. Finn and Jake avoid the one in "Marceline's Closet," so it is likely that the one in "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II" was simply a joke and that boogers are actually regarded as gross non-characters in Ooo.

name: Booko
description: Booko is a character from the Adventure Time episode "The Lich." He appears as a hologram through the Enchiridion, where he explains the functionality of the book's power and its link to the multiverse dimensions. He is accessed by the Lich, disguised as Billy, who beams a light from the gem over Billy's nose to the corner of the books shield graphic, which was a tiny compartment that revealed Booko. He is a very talkative person, and his speaking speed is fast but followable to those listening.

name: Bounce House Princess
description: Bounce House Princess is a princess who is a bounce house. She debuts in "Princess Potluck." When she invites Finn to "bounce around" in her bounce house, he feels uncomfortable and refuses. She protected everyone when Ice King attacked the princesses' potluck. As with most minor princesses, it is unknown if she rules a specific kingdom. In "Astral Plane," it is revealed that she lives in a cave, supporting the fact that she is one of the unregistered princesses; however, it might be due to her personality that she did not attend the Princess Day event.

name: Bouncy Bee
description: Bouncy Bee is the first enemy in the game Guardians of Sunshine in the episode "Guardians of Sunshine." At the end of the episode, he and Hunny Bunny capture BMO, but Finn uses the Combo Move on him and the others. That causes him, Hunny Bunny, and Sleepy Sam to either be destroyed or imprisoned inside BMO again. One of Bouncy Bee's abilities is his stingers can stretch out and drill the enemy until it dies.

name: Box Prince
description: The Box Prince is a character who appears in "Box Prince." He is the true ruler of the Box Kingdom; however, his position was stolen by a thief.

name: Boy Bear
description: Boy Bear is a character in Adventure Time who appears in the episode "When Wedding Bells Thaw." Finn and Jake take the Ice King to a club to make himself feel good about getting married. A girl bear then winks at him, and when Ice King winks and waves back at her, the Boy Bear viciously confronts him, shoving Ice King, beating his chest and foaming at the mouth. Ice King tried to back off but when two other bears showed up as backup, he got angry and froze all three, much to the disapproval of Finn and Jake, who slapped him twice.

name: Boyfriend & Girlfriend Skeletons
description: The Boyfriend & Girlfriend Skeletons are the skeletons that were risen from the dead by the Lich in the episode "Mortal Folly." They were also the ones who stole and destroyed Finn's pack.

name: Braco
description: Braco is a suitor who attempted to win the heart of Princess Bubblegum. He took his father's place in line after his ascension to court Princess Bubblegum.

name: Brad
description: Brad is a Lumpy Space Person who appears only in "Trouble in Lumpy Space." He is Lumpy Space Princess's ex-boyfriend and Melissa's current one. Unlike most Lumpy Space People, he can walk and actually has legs. He also doesn't have the typical appearance of a Lumpy Space Person and is very small.

name: Brain Beast
description: The Brain Beast (or Snake Armed Ruby Brain Beast) first appears in "Tree Trunks." During the episode, the beast attacks Finn, Jake, and Tree Trunks in the Evil Forest. Tree Trunks tries to seduce it with her "charm" and "elephant prowess." Finn saves Tree Trunks by hitting the magic gem weak spot on its back, killing it. When the creature dies, it slowly dissolves into thin air.

name: Brain Wiz
description: Brain Wiz first appears in the episode "Wizard Battle." He tries to leave the battle when the Grand Master Wizard says that the prize is not an "open mouth kiss" (as he seemed to want). The Grand Master Wizard turns him into a cat, saying, "No one is allowed to exit Wizard Battle!"

name: Brauggi
description: Brauggi[1] was an ice construct summoned by Ice King during the events of the unproduced episode "Jake-Less." When Ice King found out that Jake had lost his powers, he summoned Brauggi to attack him and Finn while they were weak. Brauggi was eventually destroyed when Jake, despite the loss of his powers, climbed in through his ear and punched his brain until he collapsed into a pile of slush.

name: Breakfast Princess
description: Breakfast Princess is the princess of Breakfast Kingdom. She rules with her sister Toast Princess and her little sister Strudel Princess. They, like most princesses, are often bothered by Ice King and need Finn and Jake to get rid of him. This is implied in the beginning of "Hitman," when Breakfast Princess says, "I've got another Ice King situation here."

name: Breezy
description: Breezy is a bee who serves as Finn's wingman in the episode "Breezy." Breezy is originally attracted only to Finn's flower but soon finds that she has a crush on Finn as well. In the episode, she is a queen to be, and she shows that by drinking the royal jelly, she turns into a queen bee. She also uses this power to save Finn. Breezy also healed Finn's arm. This powers the flower arm so much that it grows into a large tree, which then explodes. Finn wakes up and breaks off the resulting branch, revealing an arm covered in honey, which he shakes off, revealing a fully-functioning arm with a small green thorn in the palm.

name: Bronwyn
description: Bronwyn is the crossbreed daughter of Kim Kil Whan and Pat[1], who is first seen in a picture in "Ocarina." She appears again in "Wheels," where she demonstrates her proficiency and interest in skateboarding.

name: Bruce Mangosteen
description: Bruce Mangosteen is a Food Boy that made a minor appearance in the Adventure Time episode "Walnuts & Rain."

name: Bruise Princess
description: Breakfast Princess • Emerald Princess • Engagement Ring Princess • Flame Princess • Ghost Princess • Hot Dog Princess • Lumpy Space Princess • Muscle Princess • Princess Bubblegum • Raggedy Princess • Skeleton Princess • Slime Princess • Turtle Princess • Wildberry Princess

name: Bryce
description: Bryce is a demon that was being held captive underneath Joshua and Margaret's house. He was trapped in a forcefield in their house down a cellar and the forcefield was powered by a teddy bear with a tape player in its back. The forcefield would turn off if the tape player wasn't switched at a certain time of each day and Jermaine used a watch as an alarm to quickly slide down the cellar and flip the tape back.

name: Buck Pudding
description: Buck Pudding is a Candy Person who owns Pudding's Hardware. He first appears in "Root Beer Guy" when Finn and Jake buy a shovel, a saw, some plastic bags, some duct tape, a bludgeon, a mop, and rubber gloves from his store, which also sells sun bonnets, noiseless weed pullers, and combs. Buck informs Root Beer Guy about Lake Butterscotch. He also owns a pickup truck, which Root Beer Guy "borrows" to drive to the lake.

name: Bucket Knight
description: The Bucket Knight is a monster that nearly killed Finn in the episode "Dungeon." His regular form is one that is very small, but when he pours water over himself, he grows to a giant's size. It is unknown how long it takes for him to turn back to normal. He was the third to last obstacle that Finn faced in the dungeon. Of all the monsters that Finn fought, he was the one that caused Finn the most pain.

name: Bufo
description: The Bufo make an appearance in "Wizard." They are a group of tadpoles that live inside a toad's vocal sack. They bestow Finn and Jake with wizard cloaks. They teach Finn every level of wizardry until he became a master, and only then inform him he has to make a vow to become an Ultimate Wizard. Finn accepted without even knowing what vow he had to make, though the Bufo tried to warn him saying that he wasn't familiar with the terms of the vow.

name: Bug
description: Bug is a character in "Web Weirdos" that gets stuck in Ed's web. He was panicking along with Fly. Bug was almost eaten by Ed, but he was saved when Finn pretended to eat him instead. Finn spit Bug out when Ed left and it just got stuck again. Later, Ed cut the web down in an argument with Barb, and Bug and Fly abandoned Finn. Bug is probably not very smart; he directs attention to himself when Ed returns to the web and also gets caught back in the web immediately after being freed without any apparent reason.

name: Bugbears
description: Bugbears are evil creatures in the series Adventure Time that appear in the episode "Dungeon." They live in the Dungeon of the Crystal Eye; they chase after Finn with weapons when he first encounters them while entering the dungeon.

name: Bun Bun
description: Bun Bun is a Candy Person that makes her first appearance in the titular episode.[1] She was a gift to Cinnamon Bun because he did not have any candy people at the Fire Kingdom. She ends up releasing the Flame King, obliviously, and is currently residing in a cave with him. In "Son of Rap Bear," Bun Bun made a cameo cheering for Flame Princess, and in "Come Along With Me" she is seen fighting alongside Princess Bubblegum with Cinnamon Bun.

name: Bunny
description: Abracadaniel • Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving • Banana Man • Betty Grof • Billy • Bronwyn • Bufo • Charlie • Chet • Chocoberry • Choose Goose • Cinnamon Bun • Cosmic Owl • Crunchy • Cuber • Death • Doctor Princess • Dr. Ice Cream • Fern • Flambo • Flame King • Forest Wizard • Gingerbread Cookie • Gingerbread Muto • Grassy Wizard • Grob Gob Glob Grod • Gumball Guardian • Gunter • Hunson Abadeer • Huntress Wizard • Jake Jr. • Jermaine • Joshua • Kim Kil Whan • King Man • King of Ooo • Lemongrab 1 & 2 & 3 • The Lich • Lumpy Space King & Queen • Maja • Manfried • Margaret • Martin • The Morrow • Mr. Cupcake • Mr. Fox • Mr. Pig • Neptr • Nurse Pound Cake • Party God • Peppermint Butler • Phil • Prismo • Pup Gang • Shelby • Snail • Starchy • Susan Strong • Ricardio • Root Beer Guy • Tiffany • Toronto • Tree Trunks • T.V. • Viola

name: Burger Monster
description: The Burger Monster is a monster that appeared in the beginning of "Morituri Te Salutamus." Little is known about it except that Finn and Jake rescue many Hedgehog Creatures from it. It roars viciously when angered.

name: Business Men
description: The Business Men are a group of characters hired by Finn and Jake in the episode "Business Time." They are first found frozen in an iceberg floating in the middle of Iceberg Lake. After they are freed, Finn and Jake first hire them to build their Gauntlet dock. Jake then convinces Finn to hire the Business Men full-time, a proposition that delights them. When Finn and Jake ask who they are, they seem to get headaches. They perform various hero support and small adventure tasks, such as cleaning Finn's shoes and preparing his adventure pack, as well as rescuing Hot Dog Princess from some Battle Cubes. They also monitor the planet for trouble by satellite, claiming that they plan to leave the more important tasks to Finn and Jake. Meanwhile, the protagonists grow sedentary and pudgy with ice cream consumption.

name: Butterflies
description: Butterflies (also known as Astral Beast) first appear in "Still." They appear after Finn enters the Astral Plane and beseeches the Astral Beast for its aid. Finn is disappointed when the Astral Beast comes in the form of Butterflies, but Jake quickly shows him they are still helpful by using his mind to tell them to slap Finn. They help Finn and Jake fly across their room until Ice King accidentally freezes them with Freezing Potion A in attempt to make him give them Unfreezing Potion A.

name: Butterfly with laser gun
description: The Butterfly With Laser Gun appears in "The Other Tarts." He robs Finn and Jake of the last two royal tarts as they are traveling through the Desert of Doom. After he threatens them and shoots at them with his laser gun he flies away with the tart container, saying he has to "book it to Nana's for brunch." He is last seen gliding through the air, his body paralyzed after having taken a bite of the unintentionally poisoned tart. He seems to be very strong because he is able to lift an Anti-gravity tote chamber, despite his small size.

name: Butterscotch Butler
description: Butterscotch Butler, the butterscotch Scottish butler is a character who appears in "Five Short Tables" and is the gender-swapped version of Peppermint Butler. She was challenged to a board game by Prince Gumball and defeated him with ease. She, like all other gender-bent characters, is imaginary.

name: Cactus Creatures
description: The cactus creatures first appear in "Memories of Boom Boom Mountain." The mother cactus creature declares she must be pollinated to make her babies, and Finn causes a chain of events that does so. Once the creatures are born, the Dragon uses the baby cactus creatures to scratch its itchy behind.

name: Cake
description: Cake travels with Fionna, and Lord Monochromicorn is her boyfriend. She has Stretchy Powers and can morph her body just like Jake. As a cat, she also possesses the ability to see in the dark. The fur on her tail stands on the end (or "frizzes out") when there is danger around or when she gets excited (e.g., when Lord Monochromicorn speaks to her).

name: Candy Baby
description: The Candy Baby makes a brief appearance with its mother in the episode "Dream of Love." Candy Baby is surprised when its mother dumps Tree Trunks and Mr. Pig out of its baby carriage. It reappears and talks for the first time in "Hug Wolf," asking its mother why Finn was imprisoned for hugging if hugs were good.

name: Candy Cane Girl
description: Candy Cane Girl is the gender-swapped version of Candy Cane Guy, who appears in the episode "Fionna and Cake" at the Biennial Gumball Ball, and in the alternate title sequence. She is shown as a very minor background character. She is seen dancing with Gumdrop Lad 1.

name: Candy Cane Guy
description: In "Mystery Train," he is the first of the passengers to be "murdered." Since he has little to no control over the way his body rotates when in motion, he smacks Colonel Candy Corn every time the train goes over a bump. This happens several times, infuriating Colonel Candy Corn to the point of exclaiming, "I'm gonna kill you!" leading the other passengers to believe the colonel is the murderer.

name: Candy Corn Rats
description: Candy Corn Rats are sometimes seen around the Candy Kingdom. In "From Bad to Worse," Princess Bubblegum's lab rat, Science, plays a key role in the episode. Also, in the episode "Too Young," there are two candy corn rats near Finn and Princess Bubblegum when they are about to prank the Earl of Lemongrab. Science makes a small cameo in "The Suitor," looking at Braco and Peppermint Butler when they enter Princess Bubblegum's lab.

name: Candy Kids
description: The Candy Kids appear in "Goliad." They are seen in a daycare and seem to be under lax supervision. In the episode, the children are seen as being very loud and very rough with their surroundings and with each other, as one child pulled another's arm off and hit him with it. Despite the Candy Nanny being present, she showed no interest in getting the children to behave as they climbed upon her and even painted her face.

name: Candy Mother
description: The Candy Mother is a Candy Person who first appears in "Dream of Love." She is first seen sitting on a park bench with her baby and is then shocked to find Tree Trunks and Mr. Pig making out in her baby's carriage. She at first appears to be tranquil, but she has no problem yelling at Tree Trunks and Pig and dumping them out of the carriage. She reappears in "Hug Wolf" as one of the Candy People that watch as Finn is imprisoned. In "Gold Stars," she is among the Candy People that the King of Ooo and Toronto pickpocket.

name: Candy Nanny
description: The Candy Nanny is a Candy Person who watches over the Candy Kids (albeit poorly) in "Goliad." When Jake and Goliad first meet her, she is sitting in a rocking chair calmly asking the children to "settle down" while they cause great commotion, climb over her and paint all over her face.

name: Wafer Guy
description: The Wafer Guy is one of the Candy People at the Candy Kingdom Talent Show in "Five Short Graybles." He never performs onscreen, so it is likely that he had already performed. When Lumpy Space Princess talks to him and Chet backstage and says "everyone's worthless at this talent show," he is not offended. After she demonstrates her act by singing "These Lumps," Candy Magician reassures her that she is going to win.

name: Green Gumdrop Dude
description: He had no official name until he was mentioned in the "Candy Kingdom Song." He was mentioned as being in-between the Royal Tart Toter and Grape Popsicle Guy.

name: Uncle Chewy
description: Uncle Chewy is a cylindrical blue-green Candy Person with light-blue frosting as his head. He has two teeth sticking out of his mouth when it is open. He has chocolate cubes sticking out of the frosting on top of his head and on his body, which are aligned to look like buttons.

name: Jam Jam
description: Jam Jam first appears in "Slumber Party Panic" as one of the revived Candy People. He has another minor appearance in "Too Young," in which he is in a cage hanging from the ceiling and seen while Lemongrab has fallen and eaten dirt, later appeared in the dungeon with other candy people. Jam Jam appears in "What Was Missing" when the Door Lord steals his toy train. He plays with the train as if it is a fighter jet, and based on the tendency of the Door Lord to steal most valued possessions it is likely the train is important to him. His most recent appearance is in "Dream of Love," in which he is sitting in the stands with a pink bubblegum bubble candy person to watch Princess Bubblegum's performance. Jam Jam gets distressed because of Tree Trunks and Mr. Pig kissing to the point that he screams.

name: Candy Corn Grandma
description: Candy Corn Grandma is first seen in "Slumber Party Panic." She is one of the revived candy people from the Candy Kingdom. She is also the grandmother to the orange and blue candy corns. She has made only short cameo appearances.

name: Candy Heart
description: He is a blue candy sugar heart with the words "Tug Me" on him, which is ironic since candy hearts usually sport positive phrases like "Hug me." When he is a zombie, the letters spell out "Ug me," due to the bite removing the T.

name: Mr. Cream Puff
description: Mr. Cream Puff (A.K.A. Old Mr. Cream Puff, Young Mr. Cream Puff or Cream Puff) is a formerly-deceased Candy Person who first appears in "Slumber Party Panic." Princess Bubblegum mentions that they "used to date" before she resurrects him as a zombie with her faulty decorpsinator serum. About to attack Princess Bubblegum, he says, "Gimme some sugar, baby," but Finn quickly knocks him away. With her completed potion, she returns Mr. Cream Puff to his normal self.

name: Ice Cream Lady
description: Ice Cream Lady resembles three upside-down scoops of vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate ice cream from top to bottom. The scoops aren't shaped normally; her body is segmented into her head and torso of vanilla and bottom and legs of chocolate, with strawberry connecting the two segments. She has a waffle cone for a hat. The chocolate portion of her ice cream is closer in color to black than brown.

name: Candy Person 112
description: Caramel Apple is one of the Candy People residing in the Candy Kingdom. He is also one of the candy zombies in "Slumber Party Panic," in which he is the zombie that kills Starchy and the first one to be revived. In "Be Sweet" he appears to be in a relationship with Ice Cream Lady.

name: Grape Popsicle Guy
description: He looks like a light-purple popsicle with a bite taken out of him. His feet are two popsicle sticks.

name: Chocoberry
description: Chocoberry is a strawberry covered with chocolate who lives in the Candy Kingdom. She is one of the more important and recurring members of the Candy People. She is in a romantic relationship with Mr. Cupcake, as confirmed in "The Invitation." According to the storyboard of the episode "Slumber Party Panic," she is not actually a candy person and was imported from another kingdom, which might explain her thick French accent.[1]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenneth is a minor character of Adventure Time who appears in "Five Short Graybles." He is one of the attendees to the talent show. He shouts "That's amazing!" when Lumpy Space Princess first bounces a basketball off the audience and makes it into the basket. Lumpy Space Princess makes her third goal in a row bouncing the basketball off of Kenneth's face. Kenneth falls out of his chair, but still happily chants "LSP!" with the rest of the crowd after her act. He next appears in "A Glitch is a Glitch" when Finn and Jake see Princess Bubblegum he comes out of a candy house running around and screaming "My face, my face! Oh, my beautiful face!" He also seen screaming "Oh, my face! It's back to normal!" when Finn and Jake were about to ask him where Princess Bubblegum is. In "Nemesis," it is revealed he is a member of the Veritas Brigade, and he invents a high-tech device capable of disrupting parallel dimensions.

name: Candy Person 231
description: Jawbreaker dude is a mostly purple Humanoid with with a partially licked head.

name: Dirt Beer Guy (Formerly Root Beer Guy)
description: Root Beer Guy (Dirt Beer Guy) was a Candy Person who was later revived as a mix of mostly plant and his remaining root beer substance. He appeared in the opening sequence beside Candy Person 22. In "Susan Strong," he wore a witch's hat on his straw in preparation for the Hyoomans' attack. In "No One Can Hear You," the Stag licked him right before licking a Banana Guard. In "Hug Wolf," he was one of the angry villagers.

name: Todd Cupcake
description: Mr. Cupcake is a frequently recurring candy person who lives in the Candy Kingdom. It was confirmed in "The Invitation" that he is in a romantic relationship with Chocoberry. He has previously acted as a romantic rival to Jake by occasionally flirting with Lady Rainicorn.

name: Ms. Cupcake
description: Ms. Cupcake is the gender-swapped version of Mr. Cupcake. Ms. Cupcake makes a cameo in the theme song of the episode "Fionna and Cake." She briefly appears again in "The Prince Who Wanted Everything."

name: Pink Bubblegum Bubble
description: Pink Bubblegum Bubble is a minor character who first appears in "From Bad to Worse" as a candy zombie. In "Dream of Love," he tries to calm down Jam Jam, who is upset by Tree Trunks and Mr. Pig's kissing.

name: Chocolate Covered Banana
description: Chocolate Covered Banana is a Candy Person that first appeared in "Ricardio the Heart Guy" she was dancing on the dance floor with the other Candy People. She's also a contestant in the Candy Kingdom Talent Show, where she sings "These Lumps" with Chocoberry, Lollipop Girl, Gumdrop Lass 1 and Gumdrop Lass 2 in "Five Short Graybles." There are many Candy People shown in other episodes with similar appearance, but with a white covering instead of chocolate. She is later seen in "From Bad to Worse" as the zombie that bites Princess Bubblegum. Chocolate Covered Banana makes a brief appearance in "Princess Cookie," playing chess against a Chocolate Chip in the mental institution. She also makes a cameo in "Candy Streets" as one of the passengers on the train.

name: Candy Person 4
description: He looks like a Twinkie with wrapper shorts. He also has frosting covering his head along woth a purple candle.

name: Gingerbread Pat
description: Gingerbread Pat is the gingerbread version of Patrick McHale. He makes an appearance in "The Enchiridion!" with Gingerbread Pen and Gingerbread Muto.

name: Sugar Cube
description: The Sugar Cube is a Candy Person who appears in many crowds. In "Power Animal," he is at the Northern Lights Rooftop Party, and he attends Couples Only Movie Night with his girlfriend in "Go With Me." In "Too Young," he donates part of his head to make Princess Bubblegum old again. He also makes a cameo as one of the passengers on the train in "Candy Streets." His first speaking appearance is in "A Glitch is a Glitch," in which he tells Finn to stay away from him moments before the glitch dissolves him.

name: Chocolate Bar Guy
description: Chocolate Bar Guy is one of the suspects in the episode "Mystery Train." He is part of the larger group of Candy People who were simultaneously "murdered" in the boxcar. He had a travel dictionary which Finn used as a clue because it had the words "rid," "guests," and "at once" circled on separate pages. He is a three-pieced chocolate bar and appears to be an athlete of some sort.

name: Pineapple Guy
description: Pineapple Guy is a Candy Person. He is first seen in "Slumber Party Panic."

name: Banana Guy
description: Banana Guy first appears in "Slumber Party Panic," where he dances in the crowd with the other Candy People and plays the Piñata game. In "Ricardio the Heart Guy," he dances with the others as well. In "Mystery Train," he is having noodles in the kitchen as Finn and Jake look for evidence. In "Hug Wolf," he is part of the crowd Jake leads in the search for the Alpha Hug Wolf to get revenge on behalf of Finn.

name: Lollipop Girl
description: Lollipop Girl is an inhabitant of the Candy Kingdom who first appears in "Slumber Party Panic." In "Mystery Train," she falls victim to one of the mysterious "deaths" staged by Jake. In this episode, she is revealed to think about Ice Cream Guy while listening to Pineapple Guy's song. She is seen again in "Go With Me" at Couples Only Movie Night kissing Ice Cream Guy. Additionally, Lollipop Girl appears in the opening theme of Adventure Time. BMO films Lollipop Girl in the episode "Video Makers."

name: Lollipop Boy
description: Lollipop Boy is a gender-swapped version of Lollipop Girl shown in the episode "Fionna and Cake." He is featured in the opening theme song. Lollipop Boy likes tabletop games, video games, and soda water, and is on a low carb diet. Lollipop Boy is based on the show's production assistant, Patrick Seery.[1]

name: Candy Person 60
description: Candy Person 60 is a recurring background character and the nephew of Uncle Chewy. He is presumably Green Gumdrop Dude's brother as both refer to Chewy as their uncle.

name: Charlie
description: Charlie first appears in "Apple Thief." He is the bartender at the Candy Tavern. Finn and Jake question him about the disappearance of Tree Trunks' apples. He leads Finn, Jake, and Tree Trunks to Jaybird and Smudge after, so it is likely that he has some sort of arrangement with Jaybird's gang. Charlie also makes a cameo in "Dream of Love," and he serves Lumpy Space Princess cucumber water in the episode "Bad Timing."

name: Candy Tavern People
description: Candy Tavern People are minor characters who make a cameo appearance in "Apple Thief." Before Finn enters the Candy Tavern, a cherry falls out of the window, possibly due to a fight. Other Candy Tavern people include Cookie Guy, Candy Tavern Bartender, and many others. The majority of the Candy Tavern People are not directly acknowledged in the episode.

name: Canyon
description: Canyon is Billy's ex-girlfriend who appears in the episodes "Billy's Bucket List" and "Mama Said."

name: Captain Banana Guard
description: Captain Banana Guard is a character first seen in "One Last Job." He was first mentioned, however, by Princess Bubblegum in "Princess Cookie." Captain Banana Guard was, as his name suggests, the captain of the Banana Guards until he was replaced by Root Beer Guy.

name: Carl the Gem
description: Carl the Gem is a gemstone with the ability to shoot lasers. He landed on Earth in a meteor shower and landed in a volcano, where he sunk into the mantle and the heat and pressure formed him into a gemstone. He was supposed to land with his friend Gemma, but she landed in another volcano.

name: Carlos
description: Carlos is the name of Football's "best friend since college" in the real world. He lives in a pond in front of the Tree House, allowing Football to be with him forever. He was officially introduced in "Football," but he had made several appearances before then in the background.[1]

name: Carroll
description: In "Winter Light" she has become an Ice person from Patience St. Pim's Elemental powers, and now lives in the new ice kingdom.

name: Castle Staff
description: The Blue Candy can be seen at the end of the row, at the left. It is unknown what kind of candy he is.

name: Catapult Guy
description: Catapult Guy makes a brief appearance in the episode "Five Short Graybles." He looks like a green piece of bread with arms and legs.

name: Caterpillar
description: Caterpillar is a minor character that first appears in "Something Big."

name: Celina
description: Celina[1] is a member of the Hyooman tribe first seen in the episode "Susan Strong." So far, other than Susan and Sally, she is the only named member of the tribe. Her first major appearance was in "Dark Purple." In "The Music Hole," Celina is seen as a back-up dancer for Susan's song.

name: Centipede
description: Centipede is a creature that appeared in "Wizard Battle." It is a monster that came through a portal opened by Dimension Wizard.[1]

name: Chandelier Bat
description: The Chandelier Bat is a bat that makes a minor appearance in the Adventure Time episode "Walnuts & Rain." It only made an appearance for a second in the episode and was seen to be holding an asparagus.

name: Peppermint Butler
description: This infobox is for use on character articles. Do not use Template:Character on your user page; please use {{User}} or {{User2}} instead because the character infobox automatically adds pages to the Character category.

name: Charlie
description: Charlie resides in an ancient pyramid in Egypt and travels to Ooo by growing to a massive size, becoming intangible, and easily walking through the ocean with her upper half out in space. She is heavily into mysticism and Tarot cards, which she uses to read the nature of others. In "Daddy-Daughter Card Wars," she uses one of Jake's bones and a lock of Lady's hair to read her own future, which depicts her going through some periods of confusion and sadness, but ultimately winding up wise in her 90s. She then fused with this future version of herself, gaining the wisdom to realize she was treating her father badly. Sometime after "Come Along With Me," she will have a hybrid son named Gibbon.

name: Charlie
description: Charlie is a duck that appears in "Ocarina" as a tenant of Kim Kil Whan at Finn and Jake's Tree Fort.

name: Charlie Mayor
description: Charlie Mayor is a resident of Bloodskull Village and may or may not be its actual mayor. When Bloodskull Village is stricken with a curse, he asks Peppermint Butler to send heroes to help. Since Finn and Jake were missing at the time, he drafts Tree Trunks and Marceline to help.

name: Chatsberry
description: Chatsberry is a character that appears in "Evergreen." He is a Candy Elemental and one of the few characters known to exist before the Mushroom War. He has been reincarnated as several beings, the most recent of which is Princess Bubblegum

name: Cherry Blossom Ghost
description: Cherry Blossom Ghost appeared in "Memory of a Memory" when Ash showed Marceline the Cherry Blossom Wand he had. Ash trades Marceline's teddy bear Hambo— her favorite thing in the world—to get the funds to buy it. When she gets upset at him he remarks that the fact that it was her favorite thing in the world was what made it so valuable. As Maja states, the potent psychic resonance that comes from the amount a person treasures a certain possession is what made Hambo so valuable.

name: Cherry Cream Soda
description: Cherry Cream Soda is an attorney and the wife of Root Beer Guy, before his death. She was worried about her husband's obsession with his mystery novel and his lack of attention towards her. Their relationship improved after Root Beer Guy became the Captain of the Banana Guards.

name: Cherub
description: The Cherubs briefly appeared in the episode "City of Thieves" and played a short tune before stealing two sai from Finn, much to his surprise.

name: Cheryl
description: Cheryl is the mascot of Super Porp and the head of the Super Porp Factory. Cheryl is prominently featured on her company's vending machines and is also featured on a fountain inside the Super Porp factory. She is likely the last of the Super Porp mascots after Susan Strong defeats her in "Dark Purple."

name: Chet
description: Chet appeared in the episode "Slumber Party Panic." He almost figured out that the Candy Zombies were among the Candy People, who were all having a slumber party in Princess Bubblegum's castle. He heard them and freaked out and was about to explode when Finn turned the volume up on the radio, which calmed him down. He is also seen arguing with Peppermint Butler over who gets to be "Grill-meister" in the episode "The Real You."

name: Chips and Ice Cream
description: Chips and Ice Cream are characters that appeared in their titular episode. They were stuck on the head of Morty Rogers. Their previous occupation were as entertainers who worked with Morty Rogers, and now—as of the end of the episode—they are free thanks to the help of BMO, a fan of the sisters' plays. Their entire vocabulary consists of the words "chips" and "ice cream," respectively.

name: Chocolate Chip
description: The Chocolate Chips are the minions of Baby-Snaps featured in "Princess Cookie." Baby-Snaps has small holes in his body where the chips dwell, unless they jump off to perform an action of some sort. They also communicate by talking through walkie talkies. In "Princess Cookie," the only episode they have featured in so far, they survey the place Baby-Snaps is holding up for threats. They were placed back on Baby-Snaps' body and incarcerated with him. While in the mental hospital, one was seen playing chess with the Chocolate Covered Banana.

name: Choose Bruce
description: Choose Bruce is a merchant and is the Farmworld timeline's version of Choose Goose. He also has Choose Goose's rhyming problem. He ran a similar shop to that of his main-timeline counterpart, but it was burned down by the Destiny Gang.

name: Choose Goose
description: Choose Goose is a talking goose who speaks (almost) exclusively in rhymes. He sells various rare objects for adventuring or assisting Finn and Jake, but most of what he possesses either backfires or is mostly useless to almost everyone.

name: Christopher the Honorary Banana Guard
description: Christopher the Honorary Banana Guard first appears in the episode "Rattleballs" while attacking Rattleballs.

name: Chuds
description: Chuds are a group of humanoid monsters Finn and Jake encounter in a cave in the Desert of Doom in "The Other Tarts." The mutants presumably attempt to attack and kill Finn and Jake for the tarts, and while both escape, roughly three tarts are missing.

name: Cinnamon Bun
description: Cinnamon Bun is a Candy Person in Adventure Time. Prior to the events of "The Red Throne," Cinnamon Bun was very dim-witted and clumsy, even when compared to most residents in the Candy Kingdom. However, after being "baked" in the same episode, he becomes more intelligent and articulate in his manner of speech. He is currently Flame Princess' champion and knight and resides with her in the Fire Kingdom.

name: Cinnamon Bun
description: Cinnamon Bun In a Dress is the gender swapped version of Cinnamon Bun. She makes a minor appearance in "Fionna and Cake" as one of the guests at the Biennial Gumball Ball. She asks Prince Gumball "I wonder if you designed it yourself" in a very mumbled tone.

name: Citadel Guardians
description: The Citadel Guardians are at least six wardens of the Crystal Citadel. Their purpose is to arrest and imprison beings that commit cosmic crimes. The Citadel Guardians kept the Multiverse in order by keeping the prisoners frozen for all eternity. Should any prisoners escape, the Guardians would obliterate them with powerful white lasers that shoot from their heads. They have existed for a very long time, and as of "Escape from the Citadel," they are presumed to be extinct.

name: Clarence
description: Clarence was a character who appeared in "Ghost Princess." He was the lover of Ghost Princess until he killed her in a battle for her kingdom. Afterward, he became a broken man and died after consuming too much Softy Cheese at a Squeez-E-Mart convenience store and exploded. Jake was at the mart at the time, and having witnessed the Softy Cheese explosion (and being covered in the cheese that Clarence consumed), he became traumatized and wouldn't eat Softy Cheese for a long time.

name: Cloche
description: Cloche was a character who appeared in "The Princess of Rad Hats", a two-part backup comic from Issue 13 and Issue 14 of the Adventure Time comic book series. She was Finn's royal assistant after he became the princess of the Kingdom of Rad Hats, and presents him with several tasks that he must fulfill in his new leadership position. She later "attacks" Finn after deciding that he is not fit to rule the kingdom. Finn pretends to be defeated so that Cloche becomes the new princess.

name: Clock Bear
description: Clock Bear is a hybrid bear creature that first appears in Finn's dream in "Hoots." He later appears in "Preboot" as one of Dr. Gross' many Hybrid Animals. His first major appearance is in "The First Investigation." After escaping Dr. Gross' lab, Clock Bear made his way to Joshua and Margaret old office. Kim Kil Whan's employee Renny Hamlond discovered ghosts and haunting at the office. Kim Kil Whan then asked Finn and Jake to investigate. The ghosts turn out to be timeslips. Time slips are replays of things that happened in the past in that area. These time slips were caused by Clock Bear feeling sick. Finn however, turned his wind-up switch, removing all the time ghosts.

name: Clock Face
description: Clock Face was a guest at one of Prismo's parties in "Wake Up." It is possible that he is from Ooo, as his watch displayed the time it was there.

name: Cloud Dance
description: Cloud Dance is a Fat Villager who appears in the "Stakes" miniseries. He is part of the attempt to kill Marceline after she is accused of sucking the blood from the cows of the village. He soon realizes his mistake, though, as Marceline is about to be killed.

name: Cloudy
description: Cloudy is a character that appeared in the titular episode. Finn described him as 'some sort of angler lard.' Angler Lards are a species of Lard—the others being Sea Lards, Space Lards, Greed Lards, and Grass Lards—that resemble clouds. It is unknown if all Angler Lards possess a toilet behind a door, or if that feature is unique only to Cloudy.

name: Clown Nurses
description: The Clown Nurses are characters that appear in the episode "Another Way." Jake hired them after he and Finn broke their toes jumping off of birds. Since they were paid upfront, they wouldn't leave until their job was done. They believed that they could heal Finn and Jake's toes by kissing them, much to Finn's dismay and Jake's delight. They act like clowns; they can be seen floating from balloons, riding a unicycle, blowing bubbles (by farting), and juggling. Jake says "they're funny!" They traumatize Finn with the idea of there only being "one way" to do things

name: Big Clown Nurse
description: Big Clown Nurse, also referred to as Muscle Clown Nurse[1] in the script, appears in "Another Way." She has a very masculine voice. It is implied that she kisses Jake's toe to heal it throughout the whole episode. She appears again in "Jake Suit" to heal Finn and Jake when they are in the hospital.

name: CMO
description: CMO is a type of cuboid robot with a (usually cheery) face on its screen. Like BMO, it is a member of the MO series of robots created at MO Co. by Moe. Unlike BMO, however, more than one CMO exists, and indeed, CMO seems to be a very common member of the MO series.

name: Coal Man
description: Coal Man is an elderly man made of coal who appears in "Memories of Boom Boom Mountain." He lives in the same town as the Marauders. He was trying to get some sleep, but could not because there was too much noise at the time, which made him cranky. His problem was solved when his ears were plugged up by swarms of flies.

name: Cobbler
description: The Cobbler has light-green skin like the other townspeople of the town in which he lives. He wears frayed brown pants and a brown apron with a mallet in its pocket. He also wears a large pair of circular, blue-lensed glasses with black frames. He wears a large brown hat with a tall, rounded top, two lighter brown belts around the middle, and what appear to be ear flaps around the sides and back. For a time in the episode, his skin is transformed into a pebbly coat of "armor" after eating Finn's stone-skin potion-spiked gruel.

name: Colonel Candy Corn
description: Colonel Candy Corn is a character who first appeared and played a minor role in the episode "Mystery Train." Mr. Candy Cane keeps bumping into him and Colonel Candy Corn threatens to kill him. He was one of the victims that was supposedly murdered, but it turned out to be part of the prank on Finn. In "Something Big," he says he's lonely and would like a younger woman with an old soul to date.

name: Commander and Private
description: Commander and Private are the characters who appear in the movie in the episode "Heat Signature." The segment of the movie seen in the episode begins with the Private saying to the Commander that he cannot see their own heat signature. Due to the screaming that occurs when the screen is not visible, it is probable that something bad happened to the people.

name: Cookie Guy
description: Cookie Guy is a Candy Person that makes his first appearance in "Apple Thief" when he's sitting at a table in the Candy Tavern. He appears to be angry and/or straining for no apparent reason.

name: Corn Syrup Wizard
description: Corn Syrup Wizard is a character who appeared in Issue 12 of the Adventure Time comic book series. He registers to take part in the wizard battle being organized by Finn, Jake and Marceline during their search for Ewlbo. He was apparently responsible for messing up Marceline's pies, so she beats him up when he appears at the registration.

name: Cosmic Owl
description: The owl first appears in "Prisoners of Love" in Ice King's Imagination Zone, after Ice King is knocked out by Finn. When Ice King contemplates why people do not like him, the Cosmic Owl answers, "You're a sociopath."

name: Cotton Candy Princess
description: Cotton Candy Princess is a princess who makes her only appearance in the episode "His Hero." In the "Billy's Song" flashback, Billy rescues her from the Fire Count.

name: Cow
description: The Cow is a character who appears in "Thank You." In an attempt to feed the Fire Wolf Pup, the Snow Golem has it suck on the cow's udder, causing the cow discomfort.

name: Cow
description: The Cow is a character in "Five Short Graybles." She is spun around in a large centrifuge to make cheese for the perfect sandwich. The cow can also talk, unlike a normal cow. In "Vamps About," Vampire King dances with her and bites her neck.

name: Crab Demon
description: The Crab Demon is a character in the series Adventure Time who appears in the episode "Red Starved." He and Paris were planning to turn a city under the Desert Lands into sand and reanimate the inhabitants to conquer his homeland at the center of the planet, but this plan fails because he zones out for long enough for his partner to die. His third eye can shine a ray of light that turns anything (except gems) it touches to sand. Finn encounters him while looking for something red for Marceline to eat.

name: Crab Princess
description: Crab Princess is a princess who makes her first appearance in the episode "Breezy." She throws a party on the beach with numerous other princesses. Finn wants to make out with her to see if he will feel better and less depressed, so when she leaves, they kiss. However, Finn does not feel any better and continues kissing other princesses.

name: Crabbit Familiar
description: Crabbit Familiar is Maja's companion and sidekick in "Sky Witch." He is sent to do the evil deeds throughout the episode. When Princess Bubblegum and Marceline first encounter him, he drops a feather that transforms into a likeness of Hambo. Princess Bubblegum recognizes the trap and throws her googoomamameter at it, causing the illusion to disappear and prompting wooden pikes to thrust upward out of the ground underneath it.

name: Cranky Cookie
description: Cranky Cookie's statue appears in the episode "Five More Short Graybles." Shelby is reading a book on top of the statue's fist when he says hello to Tree Trunks. After accidentally running into the statue, Tree Trunks begins to cry because Shelby's positioning on the statue's fist looked as if it was making a rude gesture towards her.

name: Cream Puff Gentleman
description: The Cream Puff Gentleman is a Candy Person. In the episode "Little Dude," Little Dude possesses him, causing him to become very strong. He is used as a weapon, punching a candy horse and smashing buildings.

name: Creepy Finn and Jake robots
description: The Creepy Finn & Jake robots were characters that BMO created in Issue 5 for Finn and Jake to do their chores while they went adventuring.
