At the end of "Storytelling" after Boobafina admits her love to him, he is able to admit his feelings for her. He is very shy with Boobafina, but very excited to hear her say she loves him. Boobafina was really upset when she and Mr. Fox were forced to kiss (touching their mouths together) because of Finn, who needed a romantic story for Jake. She said she was "soiled" and Mr. Goose wouldn't love her, indicating they already had some romantic tension. He is one of many animals present at the Rite of Forest Justice.

name: Mr. Pig
description: Mr. Pig is a character who first appears in "Apple Thief." In this episode, he is referred to simply as "Pig" until later in the episode when Tree Trunks calls him "Mr. Pig." In that one, Jaybird orders Finn, Jake, and Tree Trunks to be executed by having the Pig eat them alive. Even though he worked with villains, Pig appears to have a nice personality. He was probably forced to do what he did, as he said, "they're making me do this." He has a developed an acute sense of hearing, shown when he identified Tree Trunks' lost apples by their "sound." This is fitting since pigs in real life have excellent hearing. As a result, he was very helpful to Tree Trunks, Finn, and Jake. He's also seen in "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II," when Tree Trunks is walking up to him. In "Dream of Love" he starts a romantic relationship with Tree Trunks and the two marry in "Apple Wedding." In "Escape from the Citadel," Tree Trunks begins to suggest she and Mr. Pig get a "di—" when the doorbell rings. They open the door to find The Lich, now a giant baby, and Tree Trunks joyfully exclaims that this "changes everything. They adopted the Lich baby and named him "Sweet Pig-Trunk" or Sweet P for short.

name: Mr. Pig's relatives
description: Mr. Pig's relatives first appear in "Apple Wedding" at Tree Trunks' and Mr. Pig's wedding. During the wedding ceremony, they sit on the left side of the aisle, across from Tree Trunks' friends and family. They are later imprisoned in the Candy Dungeon with the King of Ooo and the other wedding guests, but they are shortly thereafter released.

name: Mr. Turtle
description: Mr. Turtle makes his first appearance in the episode "City of Thieves." He steals a ruby from Skeleton Baby and inserts it into the larger ruby that sits on top of his head, where it fits perfectly. Not much is known about him, but it is possible that he may be royal due to the ruby crown he wears. He also has a jetpack within his shell, which he uses to escape from Finn and Jake before they are able to "purify" him. The ruby then gets stolen from his crown by Crossbow Guy.

name: Mrs. Cow
description: Mrs. Cow briefly appears in the episode "Storytelling" as one of many animals at the Rite of Forest Justice. Finn tells her to take off the paper bag saying, "You're beautiful, girl! You live in the forest, so why don't you just let it hang out?" Once she takes off the bag, she reveals not an udder, but a PHIL FACE, which blinks. After disgusted groans from the crowd of animals, Mr. Fox says "Yo, put that bag back on!" She is disappointed to put the bag back on and is the only animal Finn speaks to that does not really get help. A blue bird helps her tie and untie the string that holds the paper bag up.

name: Mrs. James
description: Mrs. James is the mother of James. She appears for the first time in "Hot Diggity Doom" voting for the King of Ooo and stating that Princess Bubblegum is to blame for killing, mutating, and exiling her son to the desert.

name: Mrs. Yoder
description: Mrs. Yoder looks like a blue jay with an orange beak. She has some sort of bandage tied on the top part of her beak (this is the reason Finn has to chew food for her babies).

name: Ms. Pig
description: Ms. Pig is the gender-swapped version of Mr. Pig who appears in "Bad Little Boy." She appears in the crowd, cheering to Fionna and Marshall Lee. She is also seen next to Male Tree Trunks when the party begins.

name: Muffy
description: Muffy is a blue humanoid who first appears in "Ocarina" as one of Kim Kil Whan's tenants staying at Finn and Jake's Tree Fort.

name: Muscle Prince
description: Muscle Prince plays a small role "Bad Little Boy." He appears at Lumpy Space Prince's party, dancing with Female Wormo. He is the male counterpart of Muscle Princess, created by Marceline.

name: Muscle Princess
description: Muscle Princess (also called Princess Muscles) makes her first appearance in "What is Life?" in the circle of princesses Ice King shows Neptr in his imagination zone. She makes a second appearance in "Loyalty to the King" when she is seen in the crowd wanting to marry "Nice King." She makes her third appearance in "To Cut a Woman's Hair" when Finn tries to get a lock of her hair, but she quickly misunderstands him and wants him to get "more serious about loving her." In her appearance in "Princess Monster Wife," she is seen with another group of princesses, complaining that Ice King stole her left arm to make his "Princess Monster Wife." She lives in a castle in the forest. Ice King kidnaps her at the end of the episode "Betty," but she breaks free from her icy restraints and proceeds to pummel him mercilessly. According to "Princess Day" she is considered to be a registered princess. She also tells Peanut Princess that her body needs juice in the episode "Princess Day," revealing a possible reason for her muscular figure.

name: Muscular Ghosts
description: The Muscular Ghosts are a group of angry ghosts that Finn and Jake encounter in the episode "Ghost Princess." Their graves are in the "ne'er-do-well" section of the Cemetery that Ghost Princess' body is buried in.

name: Mushroom Creatures
description: The mushroom creatures appear in "Memories of Boom Boom Mountain." They move by hopping on their stalk. They desperately want to dance, but there is no music. Their problem is resolved when the creatures hear jingles from the contraption Finn sets up to fan the flies away from the fish. When they start dancing in a patch of flowers, they knock some pollen loose, which in turn pollinates the mother Cactus Creature.

name: Mushroom Guy
description: The Mushroom Guy is a minor character who appears in the episode "The Pods." He dances next to the Mushroom Mayor, cursed to do so by the magic wands the Baby Pigs used to terrorize the Mushroom Village, like Jake and the Mushroom Mayor.

name: Mushroom Mayor
description: The Mushroom Mayor is a character who briefly appears at the end of the episode "The Pods." He is the mayor of the Mushroom Village. After the Baby Pigs' attack, he thanks Finn for "sort-of" saving the village, since Finn kills the pigs but covers the village in ice cream in the process. Jake rectifies this problem by eating all the ice cream. One of the magic wands' spells apparently hit him and Mushroom Guy during the attack, since they cannot stop dancing.

name: Music Hole
description: Music Hole is a sentient hole in the ground that extends to an unknown depth. It has appendages that are retractable, and when extended cover its entrance in a woven manner. It first appears in the episode "The Music Hole," where it interacts with Finn, explaining how he is fortunate to be able to be seen by others. It appears again at the end of "Come Along With Me ," where it sings the eponymous song to sum up 'complicated emotions;" Jake is shown to be able to hear and interact with it as well.

name: Neddy
description: Neddy (full name Neddy Bubblegum), is a candy dragon and little-known brother of Princess Bonnibel Bubblegum.
occupations: Source of candy juice for the Candy Kingdom

name: Never Ending Pie Throwing Robot
description: Neptr (or N.E.P.T.R., an acronym for Never-Ending Pie-Throwing Robot) is a pie-throwing robot Finn created solely to prank Jake who first appears in "What is Life?" He usually calls Finn "creator" and the Ice King "Papi."

name: Nightmare Princess
description: Nightmare Princess appears throughout the episode "Orb" as simply a cloud with a single eye. Once she is fully constructed, this cloud is shown to be her head. She wears a red dress with a yellow crown-like pattern on the abdomen. Her limbs are green with her right hand being a mantis claw and two bat wings that protrude from either side of her head.

name: Nina
description: Nina is a small yellow cat-like dinosaur. She is short and has eyes similar to Jake's. Her head has two large, rounded bumps on it.

name: Ninjas
description: The Ninjas make their first appearance in the Adventure Time animated short, where they steal an Old Man's diamonds in broad daylight in an open field. They have not been seen in the series so far. However, they have been encountered in the second level of the game Righteous Quest and on the last level of Righteous Quest 2, before the fight with Marceline.

name: None Shall Pass
description: None Shall Pass is an anthropomorphic giant sign who lives in the Ice Kingdom. It does not let anyone pass by it unless one helps it with its poetry writer's block. Finn and Jake help it by saying words and short phrases that rhyme with "butt."

name: Betsy Pound Cake
description: Nurse Pound Cake is in the shape of a square pound cake, hence her name. She is also lightly colored on all sides, indicating she has no crust. She wears a pink scrub and a white nurse's cap with a red cross on it. Nurse Pound Cake is also fairly short, and appears to be missing a couple of her front teeth.

name: Nut Castle Guards
description: The Nut Castle Guards are Nut People who guard the Duchy of Nuts. They only appear in "Henchman" at the Duke of Nuts' second son's first birthday party, and they surround Finn when they think he is trying to attack the Nut Castle.

name: Nut Creatures
description: The Nut Creatures are small creatures that first appear in "Evicted!" They take the form of ordinary nuts, but when crushed they become little colorful creatures resembling various animals and things. Marceline shows them to Finn and Jake when telling them of her travels in the Land of Ooo. One that looks like a green squid squirts ink on Finn, but he doesn't mind and seems to like the Nut Creatures. Jake didn't pay much attention to them due to the fact that he was scared out of his mind because of Marceline's presence.

name: O
description: O is a chubby, slime humanoid who has a slime "O" surrounding their face. Tiny specks can be seen inside of O's body.

name: Ocean Princess
description: Ocean Princess is the ruler of the underwater land Sound City and the Soundians. Her personality is mainly elegantly calm, mainly because tranquility is law in Sound City.

name: Ogdoad
description: Ogdoad is a demon summoned by Peppermint Butler that possesses the body of Cinnamon Bun in "The Suitor." He apparently holds the key to the level eight Shadow Realm. Later on, Braco wants to be a love magnet so that Princess Bubblegum will love him, so he and Peppermint Butler ask Ogdoad to make Braco a love magnet. Ogdoad complies after warning that Braco's request will come at a price and then transforms Braco into an ugly creature with a third leg and swollen left arm. Peppermint Butler seems to find this attractive, meaning he at least fulfilled the arrangement.

name: Ogre
description: The Ogre made his first appearance in "The Enchiridion!" as the first trial for the Enchiridion. The Ogre swallows Jake whole, but has to shove him back in several times as Jake peeks out of his nose and ear. Finn, believing Jake to be dead, steals a giant one-dollar bill out of the Ogre's giant wallet and uses the dollar to glide through the air. He then rams into the Ogre's crotch, causing the Ogre to vomit a stream of yellow barf, freeing Jake. Finn then catches Jake with his legs and flies to safety, likely skipping many of the trials he would otherwise face to reach the Enchiridion. The Ogre cries to have his dollar back, so Finn folds the giant dollar into a paper airplane and sends it gliding back to the Ogre. He appears again in "Root Beer Guy" when he is tickled by Finn and Jake to spit out a few candy people.

name: Old Banana Guards
description: Old Banana Guards are minor characters in Adventure Time. They first appear in "Bonnie and Neddy," as the protectors of Neddy's Sanctum. They appear to love each other very much.

name: Old Lady
description: The Old Lady is a character who appears in "His Hero." She is first seen being menaced by the Swamp Giant before being rescued by Finn. When she hears that Finn and Jake are trying to practice non-violence because of their hero Billy, she advises him to keep using violence to stop evil and not to listen to the advice of old people (despite being old herself). Then she starts break dancing. Later, Jake carries her on his butt to meet Billy in his secret cave. When Finn and Jake inform Billy that they saved an old lady with violence, he at first began lecturing them saying the Old Lady was "probably dead." When they show Billy that she was still alive and well, a void in his being is filled by seeing that an ecstatic, dancing, old lady has been saved by violent heroism. The Old Lady is last seen perching on Billy's shoulder as Finn and Jake run outside.

name: Old Lady Princess
description: Old Lady Princess is meant to marry Ice King in the episode "When Wedding Bells Thaw." When Ice King tells Finn and Jake that he is getting married, she is seen riding in a wagon with a bunch of female penguins, who take her to her bachelorette party. She is cursed by an engagement ring given to her by the Ice King. The ring is spiky, magical, and made of ice, and it tricks her into thinking she is in love with Ice King. She is freed from the curse at the wedding when Jake takes off her engagement ring. Then, the Ice King accidentally marries Jake instead.

name: Old Man
description: The Old Man is a character who appears in the animated short of Adventure Time. His diamonds are stolen by ninjas near the end of the episode. Pendleton Ward said that the Old Man would make another appearance in the series, though he was set to appear in the cancelled episode "Diamond Jim," so it is possible that he will not make another appearance.

name: Old Man Henchman
description: The Old Man Henchman is a humanoid character who appears in the episode "Henchman." Marceline claimed that he was her henchman for life (until Finn took his place), but later reveals that he is "just an old diving buddy." The Old Man Henchman is displeased with being Marceline's henchman, as she orders him to do humiliating and sometimes painful things such as falling down and crying. However, this is all a ruse to trick Finn.

name: Old Man Prisoner
description: Old Man Prisoner is a character seen in "Gut Grinder." He is being held prisoner by the Spiky People when Jake is thrown in jail. It is unknown why the Old Man Prisoner is in jail, but he claims that it is for the "free grub." He then grabs a grub from the floor, sticks it in his nearly toothless mouth and starts laughing. The grub looks annoyed rather than terrified, so the Old Man Prisoner may have meant grub literally with reference to the one in the cell. Finn takes the Old Man Prisoner's only tooth, a false gold one, to lure the Gut Grinder.

name: Old Soft Person
description: The Old Soft Person is a character from the episode "Gut Grinder" who lives in Soft Village. He is the one who tells Finn about the "gold-eating monster" known as Gut Grinder and the Soft People's propensity to pile their gold in the center of town and dance around it. When Finn asks about the Gut Grinder's appearance, the Old Soft Person explains that it terrifies them so much that they close their eyes and "go wee-wee" when it attacks.

name: Old Swans
description: The Old Swans make their appearance in the episode "When Wedding Bells Thaw." They are first seen kissing in a pond, and Ice King was disgusted because of that. The male swan then sucks the female swan through his beak and swallows her, which has a negative influence on Ice King, as he thought that he could eat his future wife (Old Lady Princess) and keep her in his stomach forever. Ice King then changes his mind and says that marriage is the most beautiful thing in the world, and the wedding goes back on. Finn and Jake are originally shocked and confused, but they agree not to tell Ice King that this is not how marriage works, seeing how happy he is.

name: Old Wizards
description: The Old Wizards make their first appearance in the episode "Wizard." They are ultimate wizards that learned every lesson in Bufo's school of magic. They were all tricked into spending their whole lives channeling magic to stop a meteor which has been heading towards the Wizard Village for hundreds of years. When one of them comes to the end of his term, Bufo buries him alive. There are three of them, one of whom is named Jeremy. He was the oldest of the three, so he was replaced by Finn when he mastered all the lessons. In the end, they abandon their duty of stopping the meteor (two ultimate wizards was not enough, anyhow), but then use their magical powers to help Finn save the village. They later make a cameo in "Wizards Only, Fools."

name: Original Lava Man
description: The Original Lava Man was supposed to appear in "Prisoners of Love," but was cut from the final version. Nonetheless, he is mentioned to be sleeping outside the Tree Fort, forcing Finn and Jake to seek relief in the Ice Kingdom.

name: Orphan Ice Prince Timothy
description: Orphan Ice Prince Timothy is the "son" of Ice King. He appeared after Jake set off the Doomsday Machine. Due to continuity flaws, he may not even exist, he may just be a self-aware simulation created by Ice King.

name: Other Fionna
description: "Other Fionna" is a rabbit-like humanoid who makes her appearance in "Fionna and Cake and Fionna."

name: Owl
description: The Owl is an extremely minor, non-speaking bird which appears in the episode "The Diary." It appears as T.V. reads Nurse Pound Cake's diary next to Lady Rainicorn's house, and it then snatches a barn mouse away with its talons.

name: Painting King
description: Painting King is the father of Painting Princess.

name: Painting Princess
description: Painting Princess is a princess who wishes to be kidnapped by Monkey Wizard for unknown reasons. In every different panel she appears in her painting face changes.

name: Pan
description: Pan appears in "Another Way." He lives in the forest with his wife, Rainy. He was trying to get some watermelons home to her but somehow got one of his wagon's wheels stuck in a tree. A disturbed Finn, having just crossed the Acid River, douses his head with one of the melons. Pan asks him for help, but Finn flips out, shoving Pan aside, destroying the wagon, and sending the melons rolling downhill, which flatten Pan's house and crush his wife. Pan cries and angrily tells Finn to leave. Later, Finn returns with the Cyclops tears and heals Pan's wife.

name: Papa Wolf
description: Papa Wolf is a wolf that appears in "The Monster." Lumpy Space Princess explains to Finn and Jake that Papa Wolf and Mama Wolf found her and adopted her. The wolf family treats Lumpy Space Princess as a pack member until she slaps one of them. As a pack of wolves, Papa Wolf appears to be the leader. None of the wolves talk (though Lumpy Space Princess can apparently understand their body language, and created voices for them) so the difference in significance from one to the other is rather small.

name: Paper Pete
description: Paper Pete was one of the main characters in the episode "Paper Pete," and is voiced by Pete Browngardt. He is the one to tell Finn about the attacking Moldos. He tells Finn that he can call him "PP," but then Finn just says that he'll call him Pete. He and the other Pagelings revealed themselves to him because he felt their plight when he saw the damaged books. Paper Pete is the leader of the Pagelings and has had problems with the Moldos and their leader, Mildwin. Instead of defeating them, he and Finn resolved their conflicts, which was their eating the library books, by giving them his shirt to eat.

name: Party Bear 1
description: Party Bear 1 is a minor character who made a short appearance in "Belly of the Beast". He tells questions Cubby if he is telling Finn and Jake his "fantasy stories" - which are actually true.

name: Party God
description: The Party God, formerly known as the (??? )God, is introduced in the episode "Power Animal." He appears as a large, floating wolf's head, who wears a baseball hat turned to one side. He appears again in the episode "Shh!" at the end, dancing with the bikini babes after crashing through the roof of the Tree Fort. He was the Island Lady's boyfriend in "The Party's Over, Isla de Señorita," where he was also knocked out during a fight with the Ice King and tossed into deep space. He was at Prismo's party in "Wake Up," indicating he either found his way back from space, or was summoned to Prismo's Time Room by the strength of the party.

name: Party Pat
description: He is taller than the other bears of his tribe and is the only one who wears clothing and shoes. He has brown fur, moderately big ears, and brown hair, and he wears a grey-ish green fedora with a red band and a piece of yellow paper sticking out, an olive green jacket with darker olive green elbow patches, a yellow inner collared shirt, grey-ish blue pants, and black shoes, along with a dark grey handbag. Pat is much more human-like than the other bears. It's unknown if he is just a special, mutated bear or a member of a different species entirely.

name: Party Worm
description: The Party Worm is a character with no speaking role in the episode "Evicted!" He attends Finn and Jake's party when they find a new home in a cave. He leaves with all the other partygoers when Marceline comes to reclaim her home.

name: Pat
description: Pat[1][2] is a character who appears in the episode "Ocarina". She is the wife of Kim Kil Whan and the mother of Bronwyn.

name: Patience St. Pim
description: Patience St. Pim is the current Ice Elemental. She was discovered by the Ice King, Finn, and Jake and attempted to reunite the reincarnations of the other elementals, but they escaped.

name: Peace Master
description: Through the use of his "charm sack" filled with enchanted talismans, Peace Master is able to subdue most evil that he comes into contact with. Peace Master uses a myriad of these talismans for various purposes, the most notable power coming from his baby's pacifier's capability to detect dark magic, and alert Peace Master to any incoming evil magic. The charms in his charm sack include a rubber chicken, an ankh, a purple cylinder, a book, and a gooey substance tied to a string.

name: Peanut
description: The Peanut is a recurring character in Adventure Time. He plays the role of Wilfrid in "Summer Showers."

name: Peanut Baby
description: Abracadaniel • Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving • Banana Man • Betty Grof • Billy • Bronwyn • Bufo • Charlie • Chet • Chocoberry • Choose Goose • Cinnamon Bun • Cosmic Owl • Crunchy • Cuber • Death • Doctor Princess • Dr. Ice Cream • Fern • Flambo • Flame King • Forest Wizard • Gingerbread Cookie • Gingerbread Muto • Grassy Wizard • Grob Gob Glob Grod • Gumball Guardian • Gunter • Hunson Abadeer • Huntress Wizard • Jake Jr. • Jermaine • Joshua • Kim Kil Whan • King Man • King of Ooo • Lemongrab 1 & 2 & 3 • The Lich • Lumpy Space King & Queen • Maja • Manfried • Margaret • Martin • The Morrow • Mr. Cupcake • Mr. Fox • Mr. Pig • Neptr • Nurse Pound Cake • Party God • Peppermint Butler • Phil • Prismo • Pup Gang • Shelby • Snail • Starchy • Susan Strong • Ricardio • Root Beer Guy • Tiffany • Toronto • Tree Trunks • T.V. • Viola

name: Peanut Butter Dragon
description: The Peanut Butter Dragon is a creature who attacked BMO in "Adventure Time: The Adventure Unfolds," trapping it in a pile of peanut butter.

name: Peanut Princess
description: Peanut Princess first appears briefly in Ice King's Imagination Zone in "What is Life?" She then appears in "Loyalty to the King" as one of the many princesses who are interested in the Nice King. She was first told about the Nice King by Lumpy Space Princess. According to "Princess Day" she is a registered princess, and during that episode she expressed her anger that Raggedy Princess hadn't paid her according to a prior agreement with socks and a pair of shorts.

name: Penelope
description: Penelope is a bionic adventurer who lives in the far future with her magical cat companion. She was first seen at the end of Issue 25, retrieving Carl the Gem and Gemma the Gemstone from Finn and his friends' dungeon. Later, at the end of Issue 30, where her name is revealed, she entered the ruins of Princess Bubblegum's library hoping to find something that would help her fight the Awful Offal Abominations plaguing the land, although all she found was a comic book released by Marceline. In Issue 50, it's revealed that she is a female, future version of Finn. In Issue 60 Penelope is transported to the moon and obtains the Moon Sword, and because of her bionic body she can use the sword without stopping when she feels pain. There she meets Finn, and with his guidance she kills the ---------. Then she uses her other past life - the primordial ooze - to erase the ------- from existence, since the ooze is linked to time itself. She then returns to a greener future where she is on a quest to find Bubblegum. It's also implied that her tampering with space-time may have freed Gata, though it is unknown if her mother's powers would have failed even if Penelope hadn't altered reality.

name: Penguin With Flower
description: It looks like most penguins, only it's smaller, its beak is shorter, and it wears yellow flowers on each side of its head.

name: Penny
description: Penny is a little girl who meets Jake and Finn in "City of Thieves." She tells Finn about the King of Thieves, whose chest contains things taken from little girls. It is revealed that she is a thief when she tricks Finn into stealing the King of Thieves' chest, which is full of priceless gems, pearls, and gold.

name: Peppermint Butler
description: Peppermint Butler (also called Pep-But, Peps, and occasionally Dark One) is a recurring character on Adventure Time. He is an inhabitant of the Candy Kingdom who is involved with dark magic and also a loyal butler to Princess Bubblegum.

name: Pete Sassafras
description: He is a dark blue candy person that wears a brown trench coat and a brown hat with white, red, and green sprinkles on it.

name: Petey
description: Petey, the pizza delivery guy for Pizza Sassy's, is a Candy Person who appears in "Candy Streets." Lumpy Space Princess claims that he stole her heart. He apparently is freaked out by her as well. He drives the Pizza Sassy's delivery car.

name: Phil
description: Phil (originally known as Pajama Ninja) first appears in the episode "City of Thieves" when he steals the basket and glasses from the Cyclops. His pajamas were then stolen by Rock Wall Thief, and his glasses were stolen by a goblin. He is then punched by Jake. Phil wears a special pair of underpants that can lock, presumably so that they cannot be stolen. He later appears as one of the Naked Old People in "Blood Under the Skin" and has the voice of an older man in this episode.

name: Phlannel Boxingday
description: Phlannel Boxingday is a monster hunter in Ooo, who rides around on a cloud in the sky.

name: Piglets
description: The Piglets are six baby pigs that appear in "The Pods." They are the main antagonists in the episode. They came from the first grown pod. They look innocent and act like babies at first, not being able to even hold a pencil to take Finn's personality test. The only thing they draw is a picture of an ice cream cone under "Allergies." Finn and Jake play with them and their new magic wands (which come out of the second pod) until they all fall asleep, including Finn and Jake, after building a wooden house. Finn and Jake wake up to find the piglets destroying the Mushroom Village with the magic wands.

name: Pillowmint Butler
description: Pillowmint Butler is a character, that has only appeared in video games. He acts the same as Peppermint Butler.

name: Pincer Beetle
description: Pincer Beetle (or Dancing Bug) is a bug that appears in the episode "Evicted!" and again in "Power Animal." In "Power Animal," Jake and BMO are sitting on their front steps when they first see the bug shaking his butt. Jake tells him that he is shaking it all wrong, to which the bug replies that shaking it is all that he knows. Jake does not accept this answer and shows the bug how it is done. As the Pincer Beetle joins his demonstration, other bugs from the forest come by and watch them shake it.

name: Pink Pond
description: Pink Pond is Princess Bubblegum's form in the Water Nymph's realm.

name: Pixies
description: Pixies are first mentioned by Jake in the episode "Donny" when Jake mentions that his pants are "spun from spiderwebs by pixies." They are mentioned again in the episode "Henchman." Pixies may be good creatures because Marceline said "strangling pixies is some hardcore evil," and she was trying to fool Finn into thinking he was doing something evil. But as she was trying to trick Finn into thinking he would be doing evil, it may be a good thing to strangle pixies. They have never been seen before.

name: Plantoids
description: Plantoids are a type of microscopic organism. Princess Bubblegum discusses them with Ricardio in the episode "Ricardio the Heart Guy." Princess Bubblegum remarks later in the episode that Ricardio's understanding of Plantoids is "pretty weak."

name: Plop-Top
description: Plop-Top (also known as Dump-Dome) is the second youngest of the Lemon Children of Lemongrab and Lemongrab 2 and makes its first appearance in "All Your Fault."

name: President Porpoise
description: He is a deep sky blue porpoise dolphin. In the episode "Burning Low" he wears a black bowtie, while in the episode "President Porpoise is Missing!" he wears a red bowtie.

name: Gumball
description: Prince Gumball has the same color scheme as his female counterpart. He has pink skin and his hair is somewhat in a coiffe. His head is adorned with a small golden crown and a blue jewel. He wears a hot pink shirt with the top being purple along with light pink puffed sleeves and magenta slits. He also has magenta under-sleeves (accompanied by dark-pink sleeve cuffs) and a large matching collar with a small blue jewel inside a gold crest on it. He has a belt with another golden crest and a small blue jewel design on the buckle, dark-pink trousers with purple seams running down the sides, and indigo-violet dress shoes. Unlike his female counterpart, he has visible pink eyebrows. Also, when his eyes enlarge, they are shown as purple.

name: Prince Huge
description: Prince Huge appears to be a huge and buff man similar to Muscle Prince who wears a dark pink lute suit, an odd shade of blue jester shoes, a crown and a short cane. Also, his skin color is gray, and he has short black hair.

name: Prince Prince Prince
description: Prince Prince Prince is the gender-swapped version of Princess Princess Princess. Prince Prince Prince was drawn by production assistant Patrick Seery.

name: Princess B'Onangutan
description: She resembles an orangutan with a body that vaguely resembles a skull and a crossbones shape (with the bones hanging underneath the limbs). Her body is covered with ginger hair excluding her feet and face. Her upper feet have strings tied around them and she wears a tiara with a pink pointy gem.

name: Princess Beautiful
description: Princess Beautiful is a skeleton that wears a long, dark blue-grey dress with puffy sleeves, maroon detail and maroon gloves. She wears a gold, three-pronged crown with a purple gem in the top of the middle prong. She has no hair because she died of baldness.

name: Princess Bubblegum
description: Hey... I'm a tough gum. Nothing never happening to me. Never.
occupations: Ruler of the Candy Kingdom (registered princess)[6] Scientist and inventor

name: Princess Bubblegum Bot
description: P-bot looks almost exactly like Princess Bubblegum, wearing her usual gown. The only noticeable differences are the bolts on her limbs' joints and that she is barefooted.

name: Princess Business
description: Princess Business is a princess briefly mentioned by Breakfast Princess in "Princess Day." She was present in Breakfast Kingdom during the annual Princess Day. Very little is known about her including what kingdom she resides in and what people she rules over.

name: Princess Chewypaste
description: Princess Chewypaste is a character mentioned in Issue 5 of the Adventure Time comic series. In Issue 5, Finn and Jake join in a competition to see who can walk further in an a straight line in order to determine who gets to eat BMO's cupcake.

name: Princess Monster Wife
description: Princess Monster Wife is a character in the episode of the same name. Princess Monster Wife was created by Ice King using parts he stole from the princesses of Ooo. She was very worried about her appearance and origins most of the episode, but she tried to be a normal housewife for Ice King and he seemed to care for her.

name: Princess Princess Princess
description: Princess Princess Princess makes her first appearance in "What is Life?" in Ice King's Imagination Zone. She later reappears in the episode "Loyalty to the King" when she bumps into Finn and Jake, saying she wanted to meet the Nice King. She then appears three seasons later in "Princess Potluck" attending the potluck of Princess Bubblegum. According to the events in "Princess Day," she is a registered princess.

name: Princess Zip
description: Princess Zip is an alien in the future Land of Ooo. She made her first and only appearance in the series finale "Come Along With Me", where she is seen on a picnic with Shermy and Beth, which implies they're friends.

name: Prismo
description: Prismo is a Wish Master who is the manifestation of an old man's dream. First mentioned in "The Lich," he plays a major role in the episodes "Wake Up," "Jake the Dog," "Is That You?," and "Crossover." He resides in the Time Room, which is found in the center of the multiverse. Booko describes him as "almighty." Prismo is apparently good friends with a number of cosmic-level characters in the Adventure Time universe, including the Cosmic Owl, Party God, Death, and Grob Gob Glob Grod, all of whom were seen at one of his Time Room parties.

name: Prize Ball Guardian
description: The guardian is seemingly an enhanced and futuristic form of the Gumball Guardians. It has a cuboid-shaped head, which contains the citizens of the Candy Kingdom in prize containers, hence the name, Prize Ball Guardian. It is very tall, has a dark pink body color, and also carries a boomerang/gun at their waist. Prize Ball Guardian is based on a Gashapon machine, a popular vending machine that exchanges quarters for small toys enclosed in plastic capsules.

name: Pterodactyl
description: Abracadaniel • Ancient Sleeping Magi of Life Giving • Banana Man • Betty Grof • Billy • Bronwyn • Bufo • Charlie • Chet • Chocoberry • Choose Goose • Cinnamon Bun • Cosmic Owl • Crunchy • Cuber • Death • Doctor Princess • Dr. Ice Cream • Fern • Flambo • Flame King • Forest Wizard • Gingerbread Cookie • Gingerbread Muto • Grassy Wizard • Grob Gob Glob Grod • Gumball Guardian • Gunter • Hunson Abadeer • Huntress Wizard • Jake Jr. • Jermaine • Joshua • Kim Kil Whan • King Man • King of Ooo • Lemongrab 1 & 2 & 3 • The Lich • Lumpy Space King & Queen • Maja • Manfried • Margaret • Martin • The Morrow • Mr. Cupcake • Mr. Fox • Mr. Pig • Neptr • Nurse Pound Cake • Party God • Peppermint Butler • Phil • Prismo • Pup Gang • Shelby • Snail • Starchy • Susan Strong • Ricardio • Root Beer Guy • Tiffany • Toronto • Tree Trunks • T.V. • Viola

name: Pup Gang
description: The Pup Gang is a trio of notorious Candy People who are well known in the Candy Kingdom. What they did to become notorious is unknown, but Jake says that they once threw a basketball at his head, which can be seen on the promo art for "You Made Me." The three are named Jamaica, Toughy, and Blombo. It is also revealed in the same episode that they have parents who neglected them ever since they were young, and they still crave for the love they never got.

name: Pupil Worms
description: Pupil Worms appear in "The Real You." The worms attend a class on "Theoretical Fightonomics" at Worm College, located inside a massive rotten apple near Tree Trunks' house. In it, Professor Worm gives a lecture on the Werewolf Queen.

name: Purple Comet
description: The Purple Comet, having been the Catalyst Comet, was swallowed by Orgalorg in his attempt to take its power and knowledge. Soon after, Finn uses his thorn to cut Orgalorg so that the comet (or perhaps its energy) is released to form a purple spherical object with ribbon-like shapes cut out of it and three visible eyes.

name: Purple Princess
description: Purple Princess is a character who makes a very short cameo appearance in "What is Life?" in Ice King's Imagination Zone. She also appears in "Loyalty to the King," where she is seen carrying the Nice King (who is really Ice King) on his right with Hot Dog Princess on the bottom and Skeleton Princess on the left and carrying him in a circle. It is unknown what kingdom, if any, she hails from. It is revealed in "Princess Day" that she is considered a registered princess.

name: Queen of Ooo
description: The Queen of Ooo is the genderswapped version of King of Ooo who makes her appearance in "Fionna and Cake and Fionna".

name: Quilton
description: He has a loyal assistant, who seems to assist him in transportation and other tasks he needs to accomplish.

name: Raggedy Princess
description: Raggedy Princess makes her first appearance in "Prisoners of Love," in which she is kidnapped by Ice King. She also appears briefly at the meeting of Ooo royalty in "The Duke," "Mortal Recoil," and in "Loyalty to the King." Her most important role to date is in "Apple Thief," where she is seen lying down in a ditch. She tends to giggle while speaking to Finn, implying that she has a crush on him like several other princesses. In "Breezy," she was at Crab Princess's party, but she can't reach the juice on her lap because she doesn't have any arms (Though she has arms in "Princess Day"). It is revealed in "Princess Day" that she is considered a registered princess. Raggedy Princess is the apparent princess of the Ooo Junkyard. She also owed Peanut Princess some socks and a pair of jorts in "Princess Day."

name: Rainy
description: Rainy is a minor character that appeared in "Another Way." She is Pan's wife. Finn accidentally rolled two melons over her, causing her to be rendered immobile. Later in the episode Finn healed her with Cyclops tears. Rainy is apparently pretty fragile, which is probably a result of her short stature.

name: Randall N Byron
description: Randall N. Byron (or Kewlboy) is the creator of the computer program Ewlbo. He had a great interest in computer and video games. He created a code that infects games and allows his characters to become stronger and on occasion give them his face.

name: Randy
description: Randy is a Candy Person that appears in the episode "Davey" helping Davey (Finn) build a cabin outside of the Tree Fort. He seems to have lived with him in the cabin as well. Jake attempted to rob Randy in front of Finn, in hopes Finn would stop being Davey and finally become the hero he truly is, but instead, Finn (Davey) calls the police, leaving Jake being dragged away by the police.

name: Randy
description: Randy is one of Tree Trunks' ex-husbands who first appears in the episode "Apple Wedding." He is not seen again until "Ring of Fire", where he contacts Tree Trunks asking her for his grandmother's wedding ring because he had plans to propose to his girlfriend. It is revealed in that episode that he was Tree Trunks' high school sweetheart and first husband. After graduating the two of them met at a diner where Tree Trunks said she had plans for adventure, however, Randy proposed to her and she accepted. Tree Trunks and Randy had a small wedding at a courthouse, but they were only married for a few days to weeks. Tree Trunks left him right before their honeymoon.

name: Rap Bear
description: Rap Bear appears again in the episode "Son of Rap Bear," but he is wheelchair bound due to his son rapping his limbs off.

name: Rasheeta
description: Rasheeta is a great oracle in the Pillow World. He lives alone in a small tent in the Great Abracadabra Mountains. He makes an appearance in "Puhoy" where an older Finn visits the oracle to ask for assistance in finding the wandering portal so he can return to the Land of Ooo.

name: Rat King
description: The Rat King is character introduced in "Little Brother." He is, of course, the king of the rats. Kent went on a quest to defeat him by breaking off his teeth to protect Finn and Jake's tree house, and he apparently succeeded.

name: Rattleballs
description: Rattleballs is a gumball robot cavalier introduced in the eponymous episode "Rattleballs." He was designed hundreds of years ago by Princess Bubblegum to protect the Candy Kingdom. After Princess Bubblegum kills his fellow Gumball Guards for being too violent, he hides out in a junkyard. When Finn alerts Princess Bubblegum to Rattleballs' continued existence, she tells the Banana Guards she has killed him, but secretly reappoints him "Sir Rattleballs," charging him to protect the Candy Kingdom from the shadows. In "Jake the Brick," he is seen creating more Rattleballs Robots while listening to Jake's bunny story. In "Reboot," Rattleballs appears to be killed by Susan, where she shattered him into pieces, but he is later seen at the Candy Kingdom Hospital in "Do No Harm" where he has been put back together, evident by the various cracks throughout his body.

name: Reaper
description: Reaper makes an appearance in "Wizard." In the episode, he offers Finn and Jake a chance to earn magical powers for free, but the evil catch is that they must stop a meteor from hitting the academy. Finn haggled with the Reaper, saying he wanted more than just free Wizard Powers, so Reaper snapped off his arm and made it into a keychain. At the end of the episode, he offers them a Demon heart. He may have been one of Bufo's minions. He is a lich, which is an undead creature usually associated with magic. He also appears in "Dungeon," where he challenges Jake to a duel with the classic "Choose Your Weapon" start.

name: Receptor
description: The Receptor appears in the Institute of So Und in "James Baxter the Horse." When Finn asks him where he can find the studio that makes the best "feel good" sound, he tells him to think happy thoughts and to follow the beating of his heart. He is a Pizza Person like most of the employees at Pizza Sassy's.

name: Red-faced Monster
description: The Red-faced Monster appears in "Blood Under the Skin." Crying, she picks up Finn and thinks he is her baby after Finn runs out of the Swamp of Embarrassment with a red face. She tries to get Finn to nurse, which he emphatically refuses. Jake manages to sneak Finn out of the monster's grip. No one truly knows why she was crying, but it is probably because she lost her baby. Her baby is never revealed in any episodes so far.

name: Renny Hamlond
description: Renny Hamlond[1] is an employee at K.K.W. Enterprises. Kim Kil Whan considers him one of his top employees. In "The First Investigation," Renny was sent to Joshua and Margaret Investigations to investigate a break-in that had occurred. Upon entering the building, he was confronted by a time-shifted Jake in a grotesque form. He was spooked so much that he was unable to tell his boss what he actually saw, leading Kim Kil Whan to approach Finn and Jake.

name: Representative Cybil
description: Representative Cybil is a character that appears in "President Porpoise is Missing!." She's part of the Fish Parliament.

name: Reptilian Clone
description: It appears the final boss in Royal Ruckus, where it is called Replicant.

name: Ricardio
description: Ricardio (full title Ricardio the Heart Guy) makes his first appearance in "Ricardio the Heart Guy." Finn and Jake first come across him bestowing a Best Friend Massage upon Lumpy Space Princess. He is Ice King's heart come to life.

name: Ricky
description: Ricky is a snake that appeared in the episode "Gotcha!" He is shown next to Lumpy Space Princess when she was talking about writing her book. After seeing Ricky, she karate chops him. He falls to the ground due to the karate chop.

name: Riddle Master
description: The Riddle Master is one of Jake's many imaginary monsters in the episode "Rainy Day Daydream." The riddles are controlled by Jake. If someone does not answer his riddle correctly, the penalty is death by poisonous snakes. He was blocking a door on the bridge that Finn and Jake needed to cross to gain access to Jake's Imagination machine, and demanded they answer his riddle. His riddle was: "Tell me, voyager, what is simple, and yet also a riddle?" Finn responds by stating "Man, that riddle sucks." The Riddle Master then states, "That is the wrong answer! The penalty is death...by snakes!" The Riddle Master was apparently "killed" when Finn kicked a missile at him, releasing the imaginary snakes.

name: Ringmaster
description: The Ringmaster appears in the episode "Sad Face." He manages the traveling bug circus that Blue Nose (Jake's tail) works at. In the episode, the ringmaster reprimands Blue Nose for putting too much "artsy" and not enough "fartsy" in his act. Blue Nose agrees to change it up on the condition that Goralina is set free. However, after seeing how successful Blue Nose's new, cruder act is, the ringmaster reneges, prompting Blue Nose to chase him around the ring with the ringmaster's own whip.

name: Ripped Lumpy
description: Ripped Lumpy is a Lumpy Space Person who attended the Weekly Promcoming Dance during the events of "Trouble in Lumpy Space." He accidentally knocked out Lumpy Finn while he was trying to run away from Jake, who was threatening to use the lumps antidote on Finn. Finn ran into him, knocking off his sunglasses, and was knocked unconscious by the impact.

name: Rock
description: The ability to give life to inanimate objects is probably a side effect from the "Awaken" spell, just as it is for the Cyclops tears.

name: Rock Giant
description: The Rock Giant is a drummer who appears in "Five More Short Graybles." He directs (then physically carries) Marceline to Wizard Bill's music store. He is seen playing the drums when Marceline first encounters him. He never speaks, but he evidently understands Marceline when she asks for directions. He points to Wizard Bill's music store with such force that, when his finger bursts through the door, guitars hanging from the ceiling fall to the floor in a heap, much to Wizard Bill's annoyance.

name: Rock Nurse
description: A rock nurse appears in the episode "The Chamber of Frozen Blades." She works in the Rock Hospital (the presumed name of the building), and helped the Ice King get help for a sick Gunter. She speaks with an Asian accent.

name: Rock Wall Thief
description: The Rock Wall Thief is a character who appears in the episode "City of Thieves." He steals Phil's pajamas and wears them as some sort of a cape, then sinks back into the wall. He has a high-pitched voice, but he only laughs. He later appears as a toy in "All the Little People."

name: Rock Wizard
description: He looks somewhat like a small mountain. His arms are each made up of three rocks that levitate around him and are connected as one limb, the farthest rock on either side looks like a hand and wrist made of rock. The bottom of his body is flat with dirt hanging off. He moves by levitating.

name: Rock Woodsman
description: Rock Woodsman is a Rock Person who lives by himself out in the woods in a wooden house. He makes a brief appearance in "Earth & Water" in a flashback when he is given baby Flame Princess to hold. When he puts Flame Princess down and starts to chop some wood, she goes into his house and sets it on fire.

name: Rodents
description: Rat in the Opening Sequence

name: Roger
description: Roger is a Snow Man who appears in "Princess Potluck." Ice King most likely creates him for his party or brings him as a guest in order to try to make the people at the potluck jealous. Ice King gets Gunthalina to give out snacks to Roger and the other Snow Men, but she ends up shoving the snacks into their bodies. Ice King also tries to dance with Roger, but he is unresponsive.

name: Ron James
description: Ron James makes his first appearance in "Wizards Only, Fools." He owns a shop in Wizard City called Ron James's Spell Palace. In his store he sells magic items, as well as bottles of many shapes, colors, sizes, and designs, which contain instantly-working spells. While he introduces his shop, he says he has spells for wizards of all levels, with no need for "memorization, incantation, or hard-to-find boolaroo." One simply needs to open the bottle for the spell to work. His shop also has a bottle-returns program.

name: Ronnie
description: Ronnie is a mouse that lives in the Tree Fort. His only known appearance is in "BMO Noire," where he is dating Lorraine, but finds out that she's cheating on him with Bebe. Ronnie gets jealous and kills him by taking out his batteries and frames BMO for it. Ronnie is later killed in a police shoot-out and set up by Lorraine as the patsy for the whole thing.

name: Roselinen
description: Despite being a pillow, Roselinen has a human-like appearance. She has peach-colored skin, a round face, waist-length blonde hair, and black dots for eyes. She wears an orange, floral dress for most of her appearance (unlike Jay or Bonnie). She has large lips but a small mouth, and is slightly shorter than Finn. When she and Finn are married, Roselinen wears her blonde hair in a bun with two strands framing her face. In her middle-age, her features are paler and her hair is now in two ponytails, framing her face. When Finn is on his deathbed, Roselinen's hair is white, and she wears a red dress with light-orange ropes around her collar and sleeves. Her face is now even paler and has more wrinkles.

name: Roy
description: Roy is a friend to Lee, Lady Rainicorn's ex-boyfriend, whom he had lost touch with, years later. His only appearance is in "Lady Rainicorn of the Crystal Dimension." He was a former accomplice of Lee's criminal activities and currently works at a coffee shop in the Crystal Dimension.

name: Royal Tart Path Guard
description: The Royal Tart Path Guards are Candy People who guard the Royal Tart Path in the episode "The Other Tarts." Like most Candy People, they are upbeat and congenial, continuously asking Cinnamon Bun (and each other) whether they should hold the royal tarts for him and rhythmically passing the anti-gravity tote chamber down along the chain of guards.

name: Sally
description: Sally wears a yellow-orange mouse hat, with dark brown artificial hair. Her clothes are green and torn.

name: Samantha
description: Samantha is an anthropomorphic dog who appears in "The Pit." Kee-Oth claims she tried to steal his blood, so he throws her in the pit with Jake.

name: Samantha
description: In Issue 15 of the Adventure Time comic book series, a green princess named Samantha appeared. She was at Princess Bubblegum's princess only party and was helping to make Magic Man give Finn and Jake's voices back. She decided to plan how to get Magic Man right in front of his home which was a bad idea because he heard the whole plan. Princess Bubblegum was mad at her for that so she used sarcasm against her about it and addressed her as "Princess." She said that she was sorry and also said her name was Samantha. Then at the bottom of the page writing showed up which was what Samantha was writing. She said "Yes hello my name is Samantha and I do not appreciate being the victim of most sarcasms." Clarifying that she doesn't like people using sarcasm against her and that she would much rather be referred to as "Samantha" rather than "Princess."

name: Sand Worm
description: The Sand Worm is a creature that appears in "Red Starved." It is another mode of transportation for Princess Bubblegum, the others being The Morrow, Swan, Jelly Horse, and Lady Rainicorn. In the episode, Princess Bubblegum rides in on the creature from above, entering the sand cave Finn, Jake, and Marceline are trapped in. After Marceline drinks all the red out of Princess Bubblegum, they all hop inside the sand worm's mouth. Princess Bubblegum then says, "Sand Worm, up!" and the giant worm starts tunneling back up the way it came, as the room fills with lava.

name: Santa Claus
description: Santa Claus is a minor character that makes his first appearance in "Broke His Crown." He currently exists inside the Ice King's crown due to him having worn the crown previously. It is possible that his myth did not survive the Mushroom War; Princess Bubblegum doesn't recognize his name when mentioned.

name: Schwabl
description: Schwabl is fluffy and white with black eyes and a black nose. With a tuft of fur on his tail. He looks like a normal poodle.

name: Science
description: Science is a candy corn lab rat that appeared in "From Bad to Worse." It lives in a cage on Princess Bubblegum's table. It was trained to perform complex scientific related tasks. Princess Bubblegum tries to tell Finn that "Science is my rat!" but turns into a candy zombie in mid-sentence. Once he finally figures this out, Finn releases it out of the cage for it to make the zombie formula that cures all the zombies. At the end of the episode, it is awarded a medal from Princess Bubblegum for saving the Candy Kingdom.

name: Science Cat
description: Science Cat makes his first appearance in the episode "My Two Favorite People." Finn says he comes out by the Tree Fort with Shark at exactly 4:00 PM every day and can regrow his head when decapitated, which he usually does around 5:00 PM. Science Cat transforms Jake into a butterfly with one of his battle potions which, according to Finn, never last long. Jake would have liked to cut the cat's head off, but he had to meet Lady Rainicorn for their date.

name: Science Guys
description: Science Guys make their appearance in the episode "The Real You," in which they attend Princess Bubblegum's Science Barbecue. They are machines who are interested in the fascinating ways of science and technology. After witnessing the creation and subsequent destruction of a black hole that Finn creates when he is insane with knowledge by using the Bubble creator, they proclaim the Science Barbecue the most exciting one ever. Some of them also appear in Issue 3 of the Adventure Time comics, when they are corrupted by the Ewlbo virus.

name: Scorcher
description: He appeared again in "Gumbaldia" and joined Gumbald's army to attack and conquer the Candy Kingdom.

name: Scream Queens
description: The Scream Queens is Marceline's rock band from the Adventure Time comic book series.

name: Secret Society
description: The Secret Society is a clandestine group of wizards based out of Wizard City consisting of Forest Wizard, Laser Wizard and the toad host of Bufo, though the Ice King frequently crashes their meetings. They are dedicated to achieving the "highest initiations of the secret schools" through dangerous rituals, which carry potentially destructive consequences for them or others caught in their path.

name: Secretary Octopus
description: Secretary Octopus is a character that appears in the episode "President Porpoise is Missing!." He is the Secretary of Fish Parliament.

name: Seed-Wad
description: He first appears in "All Your Fault" while being made by Lemongrab by squishing all the Candy seeds together and pouring life-giving formula on them, after which Seed-Wad opened his eyes and promptly vomited up the excess formula, then immediately looked quite startled by his own existence. After this, Lemongrab exclaimed, "Ha ha! We'll call you Seed-Wad!" For the rest of the scene, he is shown still sitting on the table with a bewildered expression on his face. Seed-Wad has Lemon People DNA, but he is made up of candy seeds so he is also part Candy Person.

name: 7718 (Bill)
description: 7718 (Bill or Seven) is a bear who appears in the episode "Walnuts & Rain." In the past, he was a salesman who specialized in candles and playing cards and was on his way to the Candy Kingdom on his carriage when his horse became unstable and went off-road, crashing into a hole. When he looked out, he found himself sinking deeper in the hole. With just enough time, he managed to make a parachute before his carriage and him went falling down the hole. Ever since then he had been falling through down the seemingly bottomless hole. He survived on walnuts and rain that fell into the hole. He carved his name, "BILL," on the wood-board he was standing on so that he wouldn't forget it, though he later misinterprets it as "7718" when reading it upside-down.

name: Sewer Wizard
description: Sewer S. Wizard, middle name Stinkums, is a character who appears in Issue 12. He registers to take part in the wizard battle being organized by Finn, Jake and Marceline during their search for Ewlbo. Marceline beats him up after realizing that he was the one "getting all up in her sewer biz".

name: Shadow Horse
description: The Shadow Horse (or Shadow Steed), so far, makes its first and only appearance in "Wizard." Finn created it from his shadow using shadowcery. He then attempted to ride on it, but he passed right through the horse. Shadow Horse dissolves shortly after saying "No touchies!" He makes sounds like a normal horse and speaks English. The shadow steed in also he seems to be in one Adventure Time commercial saying his quote. He also seems to have a similar physical appearance to Lord Monochromicorn.

name: Shadow Slender Demons
description: They are in different black shapes with red eyes, arms and legs. Some of them have dark mouths.

name: Shark
description: Shark (referred to as "Sword Shark" in "Flute Spell") is a character that appeared in "My Two Favorite People." He comes out at the Tree Fort with Science Cat every day at 4:00 P.M. on the dot, and fights Finn, who decapitates both him and Science Cat. Most of the time, Jake misses them because he always meets Lady Rainicorn.

name: Shark Sword
description: The Shark Sword is a character Finn imagines in the episode "King Worm." It is originally a sword that Finn makes up to break down a wall that King Worm goes into. His plan fails when he says he usually dreams of bad things, like sharks trying to eat off his face. The shark's lower body seems to be the hilt of the sword from the show's logo.

name: Sharon
description: Sharon is a Spiky Person seen in "Gut Grinder." She is the wife of Spiky Mayor. She was also the monstrous Gut Grinder, a costume she used to steal gold from nearby villages. After being caught, Sharon admitted she wanted the gold to buy things. She was then thrown into the spiky jail. She also acts like a teenager.

name: Shelby Butterson
description: Shelby Butterson (title: Shelby the Worm Who Lives in Jake's Viola) first appears in "My Two Favorite People" and later returns in "Video Makers." He can talk and lives in Jake's viola. In "My Two Favorite People," he gives Jake the idea to hang out with Finn and Lady Rainicorn at the same time. He has the same tone of voice as Manfried. He also makes a cameo in "What Was Missing" when he crawls in and out of Jake's viola, and narrates the ending of "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II," where he and the general cast watch videos and wear sweaters. In the winter, he wears a green sweater with two candy canes on it. He appears in "Five More Short Graybles" reading a book while sitting on Cranky Cookie's statue, and has a major role in "Mystery Dungeon."

name: Sheriff
description: The Sheriff is a character who appears in the episode "The Eyes." Finn and Jake help him by tying up the Bandito.

name: Shermy
description: Shermy is a small, light-gray cat.[1] Shermy has a long tail, a proportionally large mouth, small black eyes, gray freckles, and large ears. The extremes of his left fore leg and right hind leg are white instead of light-gray. Shermy wears a light-red shirt and a khaki satchel.

name: Shoko
description: Shoko was a black haired girl with green skin who died many years before the events of Adventure Time. She makes her first major appearance in "The Vault" where it is revealed that she is one of Finn's past lives. After her death, Shoko appears to Finn as an amorphous ghost in "The Creeps," "King Worm," and "The Vault." In "Come Along With Me," she appears in the Nightmare Juice World when Finn and Fern open the Vault. Later, part of her is shown when Princess Bubblegum looks at Finn's robotic arm and has a flashback of the arm she made for Shoko.

name: Shoko's tiger
description: It is a white tiger with blue eyes and black slash markings on its face, back, and tail. It has large blue irises but no pupils, and a large, pink, triangular nose.

name: Short Goblin
description: The Short Goblin makes his first appearance in "City of Thieves" when he steals Big Guy's ring in the City of Thieves.

name: Shrimp
description: The shrimp make an appearance in the episode "Ocean of Fear." Finn's unconscious body floats past a group of them huddling on a hydrothermal vent as he sinks to the bottom of the ocean. On reaching the ocean floor, he lands next to several more, which tap his helmet and swim away once Finn gets up.

name: Sign Zombie
description: The Sign Zombies (also referred to as Evil Sign Posts by Finn) made their first appearance in "Tree Trunks." The Sign Zombies were first seen in the episode when Tree Trunks went off on her own while following a Skeleton Butterfly. When Finn and Jake found her, she was surrounded by Sign Zombies. Tree Trunks, who did not recognize their evil nature, had naively started a picnic for the Zombies, however not soon after, the Sign Zombies were distracted by Finn and Jake, breaking out a fight with them. During the fight, Finn tried to protect Tree Trunks by huddling over her, giving the Sign Zombies the chance to scratch him. The fight ended when Jake jumped on top of Finn, turned into a giant ball and began rolling into from the Sign Zombies, knocking them away. The Sign Zombies are located in the Evil Forest. Sign Zombies also make an appearance in the Nintendo DS/3DS game Adventure Time: Hey Ice King! Why'd you steal our garbage?!! as a recurring enemy.

name: Simon
description: Simon makes his first appearance in the episode "Power Animal." Simon is the only named ladybug who serves "grass shakes" for Jake to drink. After Jake finishes the last of the shake, Simon says, "All finished."

name: Sir Slicer
description: Sir Slicer makes his first appearance in the episode "Blood Under the Skin." In the episode, Sir Slicer antagonizes Finn, telling him that he is weak because he doesn't have full body armor. Sir Slicer rides a pink horse with a white mane and tail. His appearance is always preceded by a group of flying crows against his silhouette, with a rushing background and leaves blowing in the wind. He follows Finn and mocks him after the Swamp of Embarrassment for having "crimson cheeks." Sir Slicer also hires a lute player to make fun of Finn after the Red-faced Monster tries to get him to nurse. He later appears after Jake gets the Armor of Zeldron, still making fun of Finn and Jake despite their success. However, in the end his armor proves too heavy for him to move when dismounted, and he finds himself on the receiving end of embarrassment and laughter.

name: Skateboard Princess
description: Skateboard Princess appears briefly in Issue 15 of the Adventure Time comic book series, being ridden by Princess Bubblegum.

name: Skeletal Guards
description: The Lich's Skeletal Guards appear briefly in "Mortal Folly," attacking Finn and Jake when they enter The Lich's lair. They serve The Lich to attack and stall intruders so he may drink from his Well of Power uninterrupted.

name: Skeleton Army
description: The Skeleton Army is Marceline's army of the undead, which she raises from a graveyard in "Henchman." The army consists of twelve undead skeletons with assorted weapons and shields. To summon them, Marceline chants, "Corpses buried in mud that's black, from death I command you to come back!" Although Finn thinks they are going to attack the Duke of Nuts' castle, they really just go there to celebrate the Duke of Nuts' second son's first birthday. They also appear in "Bad Little Boy" when Marshall Lee summons them to fight Fionna.

name: Skeleton Baby
description: Skeleton Baby appears in the episode "City of Thieves." He is the son of Skeleton Mom. Big Guy steals Skeleton Baby away from his mother, but then he steals the ruby from Big Guy's tooth and jumps from his arms. He then runs into Mr. Turtle, who steals the ruby away from him.

name: Skeleton Butterfly
description: The Skeleton Butterfly makes its first appearance in the episode "Tree Trunks." Tree Trunks finds it "pretty"; she calls it her "butterfly friend" and follows it into the forest. The Skeleton Butterflies are found in the Evil Forest.

name: Skeleton Mom
description: The Skeleton Mom appears in "City of Thieves." She screams when Big Guy steals her baby. According to Penny, "Everyone steals from each other" in the city, so it is possible that she stole the baby beforehand. This is supported by the fact that the baby is a different color than her.

name: Skeleton Princess
description: Skeleton Princess (also known as Zombie Princess) is the ruler of the Boneyard Kingdom and first appears in the Ice King's Imagination Zone in "What is Life?." She later appears in "Loyalty to the King" as one of the princesses who is interested in the Nice King (Ice King's alter ego). She does not say much and seems to like biting things, as seen in "Loyalty to the King," when she repeatedly bit the metal bars of the cage she was in. She is also seen with Purple Princess and Hot Dog Princess walking in a circle with Nice King.

name: Skeleton
description: The skeleton with a sword is an unknown character who appears briefly in the episode "Web Weirdos." Unlike most skeletons on the show, he is motionless, resting face down on the ground. He has a glowing sword clasped in his hand. Ed comes across him when he is wandering through the woods and takes the sword as a present for his wife Barb.

name: Skunk
description: The skunk is Ice King's present for Jake in the episode "Holly Jolly Secrets Part I." Ice King brings it because he wants to watch the secret tapes with Finn and Jake, unaware they are his tapes, along with the fact that he thinks of them at friends at times. At the end of "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II," Ice King gives Jake the skunk in return for Finn and Jake giving back his secret tapes.

name: Sleepy Sam
description: Sleepy Sam (also referred to as Silly Sam in character design images and in the "Computer Song") is a frog creature who is considered the final boss of the video game Guardians of Sunshine. His main attack is eating by capturing with his tongue and defecating them, making them lose a life. When Finn and Jake confront Sleepy Sam while inside the game, he screams at them causing shock waves that knock them away. His motive was never to hurt them, as revealed when he escaped from the game. He just wanted to go outside his cave home into the sunshine and kill BMO. Finn completes the Combo Move before he or the other monsters are able to harm BMO, ultimately sending Sleepy Sam, Bouncy Bee, and Hunny Bunny back into the game world. It is unknown how many points are earned for defeating Sleepy Sam in the game because this has never actually been done by Finn or Jake.

name: Slider Guy
description: The Slider Guys are a group of humanoids who attack Finn and Jake in the episode "Blade of Grass." They get their name from their tendency to hang around tall, metal playground slides. Finn has trouble fending them off with his broken Demon Blood Sword, but Jake easily defeats them by using his stretchy powers. They constantly moan and growl like zombies, and they walk with their arms waving above their heads. It is unknown what Finn and Jake did to provoke them.

name: Slime Princess
description: Slime Princess (also called SP) makes her first appearance in "Prisoners of Love" where she is kidnapped by Ice King. She showed a lot of affection to Finn, even going as far as saying she wants to marry him for saving her and the other princesses, or at least until Jake told her that Finn "wets his pants constantly, all the time." She reappears in "Loyalty to the King," where she is the first princess to meet and befriend the "Nice King" in the park after misinterpreting his real name. And she again appears in "Video Makers" where Finn decides to use her in a scene for his movie where she does stunts around a river filled with alligators. Though she accidentally fell in the river, she ended up kissing the alligators instead of getting killed, ruining the scene for Finn. She also appears at the premiere of the film at Finn and Jake Movie Club. She is the ruler of the underground Slime Kingdom as shown in "Love Games." In "Princess Day," she and Breakfast Princess argue about their kingdom trade of one sugar for four eggs, then Breakfast Princess tells her she has an egg in her already, despite her saying that she is an artisan and that she can't just pop one out on command. This episode also reveals she is considered a registered princess. As revealed in "Elemental," she is the current Slime Elemental.

name: Slimy D
description: Slimy D's green, slimy skin is completely bare except for a samurai helmet, brown loincloth, and yellow boots. He also sports a thin mustache and resembles a sumo wrestler.

name: Slug Lady
description: Slug Lady appears in "Slow Love" as Snorlock's mate. She pretended to be a snail, but confessed that her shell was actually a peppermint (or at least, made of it). At the end of the episode, she and Snorlock make out, much to Finn and Jake's disgust. It is unknown why she pretended to be a snail, but it was probably to find a mate, which was Snorlock's motive.

name: SMO
description: SMOs are the security guards of MO Co. who appear in "Be More." They act like stereotypical police officers, enjoying donuts and coffee, and also sport a police hat-shaped rim on their heads. There are at least ten of them. They hold laser guns as weapons.

name: Smudge
description: Smudge makes his first appearance in the episode "Apple Thief." He is a gingerbread man bodyguard working with Jaybird's gang. He threatens Finn, Jake, and Tree Trunks when they come to the alley behind the Candy Tavern asking about "apples" (diamonds). When Wormo suggests feeding Finn, Jake, and Tree Trunks to the pig, Smudge agrees, saying, "Yeah. The pig" (his only dialogue). He has a very low, intimidating voice. Despite Mr. Pig's claims that the criminals were "making him" eat the others, he nonetheless appears as Mr. Pig's best man at his wedding to Tree Trunks in the episode "Apple Wedding."

name: Snail
description: While the Snail was just a running gag at first, he eventually became an integral part of the story when he releases The Lich in the episode "Mortal Folly." The Snail comes out of Finn's bag to wave to the viewers, but then falls under The Lich's mind-control spell and breaks the amber prison by bashing it with his head. He appears at the end of "Mortal Recoil," and once again at the beginning of "The Lich," still being controlled by the Lich. In the Adventure Time comic book series, he goes into the Lich's bag while still under his control and comes out normal again unharmed.

name: Snail Lady
description: A group of giant Snail Ladies appear in the episode "Slow Love." Snorlock attracts them by beatboxing and sword-swinging, and then tries to find a mate among them. All the time Snorlock tries to find a mate among the Snail Ladies, he is unaware that he is not an actual snail himself. When the snail ladies discover that Snorlock is not a snail, they say he is "naked" and giggle at him, apparently having lost interest in the humiliated "snail". Snorlock's potential mate, Slug Lady, appears wearing a fake shell made of peppermint among the Snail Ladies.

name: Snake Runner
description: The Snake Runner[1] appears in the episode "Billy's Bucket List." It bites at Finn and Canyon as they ride past on Billy's motorcycle. It then chases them, brandishing a short sword in each arm. When it catches up, it lunges at Canyon, who ducks and punches it. It is last seen lying motionless in the desert. Despite its relatively spindly legs, the Snake Runner can run faster than Billy's motorcycle.

name: Snorlock
description: Snorlock is a gigantic green slug, though he can carry a shell like a snail.

name: Snow Golem
description: The Snow Golem makes his first appearance in the animated short, when Finn and Jake throw snowballs at his eyes to defeat him. He also appears in the episode "Prisoners of Love," as well as in the opening sequence. He lives in the Ice Kingdom. When Finn and Jake knock his head off in "Prisoners of Love," he puts on a new head of snow shaped like a cat and then meows like one.

name: Snow Men
description: Snow Men are creatures Ice King brings to life in the episode "Holly Jolly Secrets Part II." Ice King makes them invade the Tree Fort after getting angry at Finn, Jake, and BMO for watching his secret tapes. Ice King names one of them "Red Nose" when it gets an apple stuck in the middle of its face (a reference to Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer). When the apple falls off its nose, however, Ice King loses interest and pokes his own nose through the apple. When they find Finn and Jake, the Ice King says "Attack, Snow Goons" instead of "Attack, Snow Men!" They also open up Finn and Jake's fridge and look at the ice cubes like new fathers in a maternity ward.

name: Snow Monsters
description: The snow monsters appear in "Prisoners of Love." Using his Ice Powers, Ice King creates them to beat up Finn and Jake after they disrespect his territory by crashing in front of his castle while sledding. Finn and Jake easily defeat the monsters (since they are made of snow), infuriating Ice King even more. Ice King can create them whenever he is near snow and is wearing his crown. Two of them appear in Righteous Quest 2.

name: Snowball
description: The Snowball appears in "When Wedding Bells Thaw." Ice King creates it after Finn and Jake throw him the "best manlorette party ever." It laughs along with the Ice King a few seconds before he throws it to the ground, apparently killing it.

name: Snowman Priest
description: The Snowman Priest appears in "When Wedding Bells Thaw." He appears to hold some position of power in the Ice Kingdom beneath the Ice King, conducting the ceremony and advising the Ice King during his wedding. He may be something of a clergyman or bookkeeper, remembering and recording rules and laws for the Ice King. He is one of the only snowmen in the Ice Kingdom. He appears again in Legends of Ooo at the end of the game.

name: Song Birds
description: The Song Birds appear in the Adventure Time comic in Issue 1. They would always grab onto Cinnamon Bun's barrels of sweat and bring them to the Candy Kingdom.

name: Space Angel Princess
description: Space Angel Princess is a princess of an unknown kingdom. She makes a cameo in the episode "What is Life?" in Ice King's Imagination Zone. She appears in "Loyalty to the King" with an updated design as one of the princesses being held in Nice King's cage. She shouts "Nice King, I love you!" when she is in the cage. She makes a cameo in the episode "Ocarina," in which she seems to be purchasing a room in Finn and Jake's home. According to "Princess Day" she is a registered princess.

name: Space Lards
description: Space Lards are a species of lard (the others being Sea Lards, Greed Lards, Grass Lards, and Angler Lards) that are first introduced in "Astral Plane." The lards can be found in space, and a group of them are seen by Finn near the Earth.

name: Space Moth
description: The Space Moth is a creature first seen in "On the Lam." It is an alien from a distant planet that Martin escapes into space on. It reappears in "The Comet," with Martin still riding in it through space, where they encounter Finn. After Martin took the Purple Comet's request of joining her on a higher plane of existence, the Space Moth joined them.

name: Space Wedding People
description: The Space Wedding People all wear space suits made of crystal under formal clothing, most likely due to their location in space and the event of a wedding. They have eyes that resemble the ones of a dog or a Rainicorn, as well as jowls similar to a dog's.

name: Sparkle
description: Sparkle (also known as Ricky) is a baby who appeared in "BMO Lost." BMO found him in the forest and at first thought he was a carnivore. Upon discovering that it was a baby instead, it thought Sparkle was lost. So it tried to take him home with it until his mother came along and took him instead.

name: Sparkle's mother
description: Sparkle's mother is the mother of Sparkle the baby. When BMO takes Sparkle with it on its journey home, his mother comes looking for him. She confirms that "Sparkle" is the baby's name (thus proving Bubble right). BMO hesitates to give up the baby that it dubbed "Ricky," at which point, Sparkle's mother tells BMO it "should be ashamed of itself."

name: Spear Bear
description: Spear Bear is a bear who appears in the episode "I Am a Sword." He makes an appearance with Science Cat who may be his new partner since Sword Shark has passed away.

name: Spider
description: The spider plays a minor role in "Marceline's Closet." When Jake tries to escape Marceline's closet by digging a small hole in the wall with a spoon, the spider chases the shrunken Jake out. The spider then pushes Marceline's lamp off her nightstand. Near the end of the episode, the spider distracts Jake when he and Finn try to break out of Marceline's house. It ends up biting Jake.

name: Spider Ghost
description: Spider Ghost Is a Ghost with four eyes, six arms and three distinct body segments.

name: Spider-snake hybrid
description: The spider-snake hybrid is a creature that appears in "A Glitch is a Glitch." Jake accidentally creates it when he merges a normal spider and snake in the universal source code. It later attacks the immobilized Ice King.

name: Cameron
description: The Spiky Mayor (real name, Cameron) is the leader of the Spiky People seen in "Gut Grinder." He captures and imprisons Jake under the suspicion of his being the Gut Grinder, but is later shocked to discover that the Gut Grinder was actually his wife, Sharon. Then without thinking twice, he shortly imprisons her.

name: Spirits
description: Spirits appear in "Mortal Recoil" and "Beyond this Earthly Realm." Ice King is able to see them with his Wizard Eyes. Although the spirits' physical appearance ranges from grotesque to peculiar, they are largely docile creatures and are considered to be minor annoyances to those that can see them; with the exception of sometimes touching or grossing out the Ice King who can never stop seeing them. Several of them are distinguished by the Ice King, such as The Dead One.
